subject: b'coe-fac: Lunch with Marsha Kline Pruett Today'
html:
b'
Hello,
Just a reminder of this event taking place today.
Thanks,
Lisa

From: Benedict McWhirter
Sent: Tuesday, February 28, 2017 4:55 PM
To: cpsylist at lists.uoregon.edu; cftlist at lists.uoregon.edu; prevscilist at lists.uoregon.edu
Cc: Lisa Fortin <lfortin at uoregon.edu>
Subject: FW: email to circulate about lunch with Marsha Kline Pruett

Greetings all
Please place this on your calendars as this should be extremely interesting!  Plus, lunch!!
Benedict
________________________________________________
Benedict T. McWhirter, Ph.D.
Department Head, Counseling Psychology & Human Services
Professor, Counseling Psychology Program
College of Education
University of Oregon
Eugene, Oregon, 97403-5251
U.S.A.
benmcw at uoregon.edu<mailto:benmcw at uoregon.edu>
541-346-2410


Is this email not displaying correctly?
View it in your browser<http://us5.campaign-archive2.com/?u=8a06b91ec7529a459284ee127&id=de0169e3dd&e=>.



[https://gallery.mailchimp.com/8a06b91ec7529a459284ee127/images/457bbe77-3e04-413a-9fc6-92b193b95a4f.jpg]



Come have lunch and informal conversation with Marsha Kline Pruett!
Monday, March 13, noon - 1:30
230T HEDCO

[https://gallery.mailchimp.com/8a06b91ec7529a459284ee127/images/cf8de8c2-6567-4b67-b222-752e18ecb47e.jpg]
Marsha Kline Pruett is a prominent developmental researcher. She is Maconda Brown O'Connor Chair and Director of the Clinical Research Institute, Smith College School for Social Work. Her current focus examines family dynamics and child development with a specialization on life transitions related to adverse events or circumstances. Pruett is known nationally for the development, implementation, and evaluation of preventive interventions in schools and courts. Among other topics, these programs have addressed mandatory parenting education for separating parents, supporting father involvement in diverse communities, and creating innovative roles for undergraduate and graduate students in trauma-informed secondary education.

Pruett will also be participating in a panel discussion on March 14 at  4 pm, \xe2\x80\x9cWhat Kids Bring to School: How educators can address poverty, domestic violence, and other challenges affecting their students.For more details, visit our website<http://waynemorsecenter.uoregon.edu/event/what-kids-bring-to-school-how-educators-can-address-poverty-domestic-violence-and-other-issues-affecting-their-students/>.

[https://gallery.mailchimp.com/8a06b91ec7529a459284ee127/images/457bbe77-3e04-413a-9fc6-92b193b95a4f.jpg]



Come have lunch and informal conversation with Marsha Kline Pruett!
Monday, March 13, noon - 1:30
230T HEDCO

[https://gallery.mailchimp.com/8a06b91ec7529a459284ee127/images/cf8de8c2-6567-4b67-b222-752e18ecb47e.jpg]
Marsha Kline Pruett is a prominent developmental researcher. She is Maconda Brown O'Connor Chair and Director of the Clinical Research Institute, Smith College School for Social Work. Her current focus examines family dynamics and child development with a specialization on life transitions related to adverse events or circumstances. Pruett is known nationally for the development, implementation, and evaluation of preventive interventions in schools and courts. Among other topics, these programs have addressed mandatory parenting education for separating parents, supporting father involvement in diverse communities, and creating innovative roles for undergraduate and graduate students in trauma-informed secondary education.

Pruett will also be participating in a panel discussion on March 14 at  4 pm, \xe2\x80\x9cWhat Kids Bring to School: How educators can address poverty, domestic violence, and other challenges affecting their students.For more details, visit our website<http://waynemorsecenter.uoregon.edu/event/what-kids-bring-to-school-how-educators-can-address-poverty-domestic-violence-and-other-issues-affecting-their-students/>.

subject: b'coe-fac: student research opportunities - updated document for\tspring term'
html:
b'
Hello COE faculty and ROC units,

Spring term is quickly approaching and we would once again like to update our student research opportunity document to make sure it is accurate and inclusive of all possible student research opportunities.

If you have a volunteer or credit-based research opportunity for students for spring term (undergrad or grad), and you would like it included in this document for distribution to program directors, student services coordinators, and on the 1st floor bulletin boards, please email your project's information to Mercedes (copied here) by March 19th. Please use a format similar to that included in the current document so that students have a good sense of the research they would participate in and how to apply.

Thanks,
Leslie


***********
Leslie Leve, PhD
Professor and Associate Dean for Research and Faculty Development
College of Education
Associate Director, Prevention Science Institute
University of Oregon

Phone: 541-346-9601
Web: https://education.uoregon.edu/users/leslie-leve

subject: b'coe-fac: AERA Brochure Draft'
html:
b'
Hello,
As in previous years, we are assembling a brochure to showcase our presentations at the AERA conference.  I pulled information from the AERA online program listing to start the process and I've attached that document for your review.  However, the data sometimes doesn't come across complete (especially if you are listed as from a research or outreach unit and not as from the UO) so please look at this with a critical eye.

Let me know:
If you are receiving special recognition at the event;
Information on a presentation that is missing;
Any people who aren't listed as participants that you think should be listed.

I'll be sending out a separate email with an invitation to RSVP to the reception.  Let me know if you have any questions.

Thanks,
Lisa



Lisa Fortin
Director of Events and Student Recruitment
College of Education, University of Oregon
Ph:  541-346-1607

subject: b'coe-fac: FW: Question about email lists for program recruitment'
html:
b'
Sent on behalf of Tanya Sheehan

Undergraduate Research Fellowship


Students in education or a related field (e.g., Communication Sciences and Disorders, Psychology, Educational Methodology) who demonstrate substantial interest in research and who intend to pursue graduate school are encouraged to apply to the Undergraduate Research Fellowship (URF) program. The URF program supports Oregon residents who are full-time students of junior or senior class standing with a cumulative GPA of at least 3.50. Students who receive an URF award will work as valued members of a research team and earn a tuition waiver for the 2017-18 academic year. See attached flyer for more information, or visit http://ctl.uoregon.edu/research/urf

subject: b'coe-fac: COE FACULTY FUND AWARDS - CALL FOR PROPOSALS'
html:
b'
COLLEGE OF EDUCATION FACULTY FUND AWARDS
Proposal for Project Grant<https://coe.uoregon.edu/facultyfundawards/>
The College of Education's Faculty Fund Awards provide financial support for the innovative ideas that contribute to the development of the early career of our faculty members. Funding is meant to catalyze projects and help faculty members achieve sustainability.
Eligibility: [NEW THIS YEAR]

*         All College of Education faculty (FTE of .5 or greater) are eligible to apply for awards, both NTTF and Tenure Faculty.

*         The Kruger Award is available for the three career development units (IntoCareers, CIS, and Destny).

*         The Skippen Award is available for EMPL faculty only.

*         All COE department faculty are eligible for the Andrea Wiggins Fund for Faculty Outreach and the Judson and Elise Taylor Fund.
Applications will be based on meritorious factors that include:
*    Projects which are not yet funded or have no other funding sources available
*    Projects in a current area of priority or importance for the college
*    High visibility projects
*    Applicants that have not received a faculty fund award in the past three years
Application Steps:
*    Complete and submit the proposal application<https://coe.uoregon.edu/facultyfundawards/> by March 31, 2017.
*    Deans of the College of Education will notify applicants being considered by April 10, 2017.
*    Preliminary proposal applicants chosen will submit fuller proposals that:
o    Develop the design and implementation plans
o    Propose a plan to evaluate the initiative
o    Propose a detailed budget. Please get input from your business manager as you develop a budget to insure that all proposed costs are reasonable and allowable.
*    Final applications will be due April 17, 2017. Applications will be reviewed and award decisions made by the deans of the College of Education. The COE Office of Development will review applications for alignment with the fund's intention.
*    Project funding will be announced by April 28, 2017.
*    Lead faculty in any funded project will give an annual written update to the donor. The awardees will also provide the COE Office of Development with necessary narrative and fiscal information to submit an annual report to the donor on the use and impact of funds.
Preliminary Proposal<https://coe.uoregon.edu/facultyfundawards/> deadline: March 31, 2017
Review the funds available and determine which funding source is the best fit for your proposed project. Complete and submit the proposal form<https://coe.uoregon.edu/facultyfundawards/>.
Please contact Andrea Olson<mailto:andreao at uoregon.edu?subject=COE%20Faculty%20Fund%20Award%20Proposal> with any questions.

________________________________

subject: b'coe-fac: COE BANEY FUND GUEST SPEAKER AWARD - CALL FOR PROPOSALS'
html:
b'
Baney Fund Guest Speaker Award
Proposal for Guest Speaker Grant from the Hope Baney Fund Award<https://coe.uoregon.edu/facultyfundawards/>

The College of Education's Hope Baney Fund provides financial support for faculty presentations and outreach. Funding is available to host up to four guest speakers to the UO College of Education. Awards will be $3,000 each.
The Hope Baney Fund was established through the will of Hope Baney to support lectureships on significant issues affecting education and short term projects undertaken by College of Education faculty.
Eligibility: All College of Education faculty (FTE of .5 or greater) are eligible to apply for awards, both NTTF and Tenure Faculty.
Applications will be based on meritorious factors that include:
*    Speakers which are not yet funded or have no other funding sources available.
*    Speakers in a current area of priority or importance for the college.
*    High visibility projects
Application Steps:
*    Complete and submit the proposal application<https://coe.uoregon.edu/facultyfundawards/> by March 31, 2017.
*    Deans of the College of Education will notify applicants being considered by April 10, 2017.
*    Preliminary proposal applicants chosen will submit fuller proposals that:
o    Develop the design and implementation plans
o    Propose a plan to evaluate the initiative
o    Propose a detailed budget. Please get input from your business manager as you develop a budget to insure that all proposed costs are reasonable and allowable.
*    Final applications will be due April 17, 2017. Applications will be reviewed and award decisions made by the deans of the College of Education. The COE Office of Development will review applications for alignment with the fund's intention.
*    Project funding will be announced by April 28, 2017.
*    Lead faculty in any funded project will give an annual written update to the donor. The awardees will also provide the COE Office of Development with necessary narrative and fiscal information to submit an annual report to the donor on the use and impact of funds.
Preliminary Proposal<https://coe.uoregon.edu/facultyfundawards/> deadline: March 31, 2017
Please contact Andrea Olson<mailto:andreao at uoregon.edu?subject=COE%20Faculty%20Fund%20Awards> with any questions.

o    Develop the design and implementation plans
o    Propose a plan to evaluate the initiative
o    Propose a detailed budget. Please get input from your business manager as you develop a budget to insure that all proposed costs are reasonable and allowable.
*    Final applications will be due April 17, 2017. Applications will be reviewed and award decisions made by the deans of the College of Education. The COE Office of Development will review applications for alignment with the fund's intention.
*    Project funding will be announced by April 28, 2017.
*    Lead faculty in any funded project will give an annual written update to the donor. The awardees will also provide the COE Office of Development with necessary narrative and fiscal information to submit an annual report to the donor on the use and impact of funds.
Preliminary Proposal<https://coe.uoregon.edu/facultyfundawards/> deadline: March 31, 2017
Please contact Andrea Olson<mailto:andreao at uoregon.edu?subject=COE%20Faculty%20Fund%20Awards> with any questions.

________________________________

subject: b'coe-fac: COE FACULTY FUND AWARDS - CALL FOR PROPOSALS'
html:
b'
Hi COE Faculty,
Please note a clarification for eligibility: All College of Education faculty (FTE of .5 or greater) are eligible for the Andrea Wiggins Fund for Faculty Outreach and the Judson and Elise Taylor Fund. The proposal application previously said "department faculty" are eligible.
~Andrea



From: Andrea Olson
Sent: Friday, March 17, 2017 11:41 AM
To: coe-fac at lists.uoregon.edu
Subject: COE FACULTY FUND AWARDS - CALL FOR PROPOSALS

COLLEGE OF EDUCATION FACULTY FUND AWARDS
Proposal for Project Grant<https://coe.uoregon.edu/facultyfundawards/>
The College of Education's Faculty Fund Awards provide financial support for the innovative ideas that contribute to the development of the early career of our faculty members. Funding is meant to catalyze projects and help faculty members achieve sustainability.
Eligibility: [NEW THIS YEAR]

*         All College of Education faculty (FTE of .5 or greater) are eligible to apply for awards, both NTTF and Tenure Faculty.

*         The Kruger Award is available for the three career development units (IntoCareers, CIS, and Destny).

*         The Skippen Award is available for EMPL faculty only.

*         All College of Education faculty (FTE of .5 or greater) are eligible for the Andrea Wiggins Fund for Faculty Outreach and the Judson and Elise Taylor Fund.
Applications will be based on meritorious factors that include:
*    Projects which are not yet funded or have no other funding sources available
*    Projects in a current area of priority or importance for the college
*    High visibility projects
*    Applicants that have not received a faculty fund award in the past three years
Application Steps:
*    Complete and submit the proposal application<https://coe.uoregon.edu/facultyfundawards/> by March 31, 2017.
*    Deans of the College of Education will notify applicants being considered by April 10, 2017.
*    Preliminary proposal applicants chosen will submit fuller proposals that:
o    Develop the design and implementation plans
o    Propose a plan to evaluate the initiative
o    Propose a detailed budget. Please get input from your business manager as you develop a budget to insure that all proposed costs are reasonable and allowable.
*    Final applications will be due April 17, 2017. Applications will be reviewed and award decisions made by the deans of the College of Education. The COE Office of Development will review applications for alignment with the fund's intention.
*    Project funding will be announced by April 28, 2017.
*    Lead faculty in any funded project will give an annual written update to the donor. The awardees will also provide the COE Office of Development with necessary narrative and fiscal information to submit an annual report to the donor on the use and impact of funds.
Preliminary Proposal<https://coe.uoregon.edu/facultyfundawards/> deadline: March 31, 2017
Review the funds available and determine which funding source is the best fit for your proposed project. Complete and submit the proposal form<https://coe.uoregon.edu/facultyfundawards/>.
Please contact Andrea Olson<mailto:andreao at uoregon.edu?subject=COE%20Faculty%20Fund%20Award%20Proposal> with any questions.

________________________________

subject: b'coe-fac: Invitation to AERA Reception'
html:
b'
Hello,
For those of you attending the AERA conference, I\xe2\x80\x99d like to invite all of you to our UO College of Education Reception, to be held on Sunday, April 30th from 6:30 pm \xe2\x80\x93 8:30 pm.  Food and beverages will be provided by Boudro\xe2\x80\x99s Texas Bistro.  Our event is located one block off of the Riverwalk at the Vault at 314 E. Commerce Street.  Please feel free to forward this invitation to friends and colleagues also attending the conference.  Please click here to RSVP<https://oregon.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_9Yyk0zgcEZmZiTj>.    Let me know if you have any questions!
Lisa


You're invited!
[http://r20.rs6.net/on.jsp?ca=61d6bbec-2283-4311-85eb-696be9e82e69&a=1127190466962&r=3&c=&ch=]






[https://files.constantcontact.com/29199c17601/9df5a0ee-f1dd-457a-ae51-d15e8765cf5f.gif]



You are cordially invited to the
University of Oregon AERA reception,
Sunday, April 30 from 6:30 pm - 8:30 pm.
Please join us for complimentary drinks,
specialty margaritas, and food provided by
Boudro\xe2\x80\x99s Texas Bistro.
Our event is located one block off
of the Riverwalk at the Vault
at 314 E. Commerce Street
(on the corner of Presa and Commerce).
All faculty and friends of the UO College of Education
are invited.
Click here to RSVP<https://oregon.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_9Yyk0zgcEZmZiTj>



















University of Oregon | 1215 University of Oregon, Eugene, OR 97403

subject: b'coe-fac: RCS: Education and Outreach Opportunities for Spring and\tSummer 2017'
html:
b'
COE faculty and graduate students,

Please see the attached flyer about an IRB workshop focused on conducting research with children and teens, to be held April 12, 12-1:30 in Hedco 230T. This workshop is open to all UO faculty and students, but is especially relevant to our COE research populations. I encourage you to attend if you have some tricky human subjects issues with your study samples and/or you are newer to leading your own research with children.

Registration required, see link below (also see the other workshop offerings below that may be of interest).

Thanks, and have a wonderful spring break!

Leslie

***********
Leslie Leve, PhD
Professor and Associate Dean for Research and Faculty Development
College of Education
Associate Director, Prevention Science Institute
University of Oregon

Phone: 541-346-9601
Web: https://education.uoregon.edu/users/leslie-leve

[Macintosh HD:Users:tjordan:Documents:current-jobs:__UO branding main:__UO Brand Elements Jun15:UO Business Papers:Electronic letterhead:UO Secondary Sig LH:UO Digital LH - COE:COE-3435-CGY11-4C.png]




From: "Research edu>" <researchcompliance at uoregon.edu<mailto:researchcompliance at uoregon.edu>>
Date: Friday, March 24, 2017 at 12:43 PM
To: "Research edu>" <researchcompliance at uoregon.edu<mailto:researchcompliance at uoregon.edu>>
Cc: Caitlin Alcorn <calcorn at uoregon.edu<mailto:calcorn at uoregon.edu>>, craig carolyn <craig3 at uoregon.edu<mailto:craig3 at uoregon.edu>>, Sheryl Johnson <sherylj at uoregon.edu<mailto:sherylj at uoregon.edu>>
Subject: RCS: Education and Outreach Opportunities for Spring and Summer 2017

Dear UO Research Community,

Research Compliance Services (RCS) has recently posted our workshop offerings for Spring and Summer 2017 and will continue to hold routine office hours.  This term we are offering a special session for those who conduct research with children or teens (see flyer attached!).

Below are some of the planned workshops.  Visit our education and outreach page for more information about our education and outreach program, future offerings, and the current office hours schedule: http://rcs.uoregon.edu/content/education-training.

Upcoming Workshops: *
April 12, 2017, 12:00pm-1:30pm

Human Subject Research Involving Children and Teens<https://odt.uoregon.edu/registration/course_view.php?crse_id=737>

April 18, 2017, 1:00pm-2:30pm

IRB Submission and Protocol Development Workshop<http://odt.uoregon.edu/registration/session_view.php?sess_id=8378>

April 21, 2017, 1:00pm-2:30pm

How to Write a Research Plan for IRB Submission<http://odt.uoregon.edu/registration/session_view.php?sess_id=8381>

May 15, 2017, 11:00am-12:30pm

IRB Submission and Protocol Development Workshop<http://odt.uoregon.edu/registration/session_view.php?sess_id=8379>

May 18, 2017, 11:00am-12:30pm

How to Write a Research Plan for IRB Submission<http://odt.uoregon.edu/registration/session_view.php?sess_id=8383>

August 9, 2017, 10:00am-11:30am

IRB Submission and Protocol Development Workshop<http://odt.uoregon.edu/registration/session_view.php?sess_id=8380>

August 10, 2017, 10:00am-11:30am

How to Write a Research Plan for IRB Submission<http://odt.uoregon.edu/registration/session_view.php?sess_id=8384>

*Click on the workshop links above for more information and to access registration through Making Tracks<http://odt.uoregon.edu/registration/>.

Office Hours: **
Tuesdays, 10 a.m. - 12 p.m.

Wednesdays, 2 p.m. - 4 p.m.

**Find us here<http://rcs.uoregon.edu/content/contact-us>.

As a reminder, we are also available for group and class presentations and available for scheduled consultations.

Please share this message with any of your colleagues and students you think might be interested.   Feel free to contact our office with questions or for more information at (541)346-2510 or researchcompliance at uoregon.edu<mailto:researchcompliance at uoregon.edu>.

Sincerely,
Research Compliance Services
University of Oregon
541-346-2510

Subject: RCS: Education and Outreach Opportunities for Spring and Summer 2017

Dear UO Research Community,

Research Compliance Services (RCS) has recently posted our workshop offerings for Spring and Summer 2017 and will continue to hold routine office hours.  This term we are offering a special session for those who conduct research with children or teens (see flyer attached!).

Below are some of the planned workshops.  Visit our education and outreach page for more information about our education and outreach program, future offerings, and the current office hours schedule: http://rcs.uoregon.edu/content/education-training.

Upcoming Workshops: *
April 12, 2017, 12:00pm-1:30pm

Human Subject Research Involving Children and Teens<https://odt.uoregon.edu/registration/course_view.php?crse_id=737>

April 18, 2017, 1:00pm-2:30pm

IRB Submission and Protocol Development Workshop<http://odt.uoregon.edu/registration/session_view.php?sess_id=8378>

April 21, 2017, 1:00pm-2:30pm

How to Write a Research Plan for IRB Submission<http://odt.uoregon.edu/registration/session_view.php?sess_id=8381>

May 15, 2017, 11:00am-12:30pm

IRB Submission and Protocol Development Workshop<http://odt.uoregon.edu/registration/session_view.php?sess_id=8379>

May 18, 2017, 11:00am-12:30pm

How to Write a Research Plan for IRB Submission<http://odt.uoregon.edu/registration/session_view.php?sess_id=8383>

August 9, 2017, 10:00am-11:30am

IRB Submission and Protocol Development Workshop<http://odt.uoregon.edu/registration/session_view.php?sess_id=8380>

August 10, 2017, 10:00am-11:30am

How to Write a Research Plan for IRB Submission<http://odt.uoregon.edu/registration/session_view.php?sess_id=8384>

*Click on the workshop links above for more information and to access registration through Making Tracks<http://odt.uoregon.edu/registration/>.

Office Hours: **
Tuesdays, 10 a.m. - 12 p.m.

Wednesdays, 2 p.m. - 4 p.m.

**Find us here<http://rcs.uoregon.edu/content/contact-us>.

As a reminder, we are also available for group and class presentations and available for scheduled consultations.

Please share this message with any of your colleagues and students you think might be interested.   Feel free to contact our office with questions or for more information at (541)346-2510 or researchcompliance at uoregon.edu<mailto:researchcompliance at uoregon.edu>.

Sincerely,
Research Compliance Services

subject: b'coe-fac: Winter Curriculum update'
html:
b'
Faculty,

Hope you had a good spring break. This email will update you to the curriculum happenings from Winter term and expectations/dates for Spring.


*         Permanent Course and Program Review during winter 2016

*         Academic Extension

*         EDUC Courses and Requirements

*         Senate Policies

*         Curriculum Committee Membership and Resources

*         Coming in spring 2017

Permanent Course and Program Review during Winter 2016


Course Review. The UO is still using CourseLeaf. All courses can be reviewed throughout the year through CourseLeaf Management System (https://nextcatalog.uoregon.edu/courseadmin/).

There are 5 courses that were reviewed by the
*         EDUC  613 Philosophy of Research: Exploring Foundational Questions - New course. Course has been held at COECC until a committee designed to review the EDUC policy has completed its work.
*         ASL 311 ASL for Educators drop this course
*         CDS 446 Services for Deaf Students this is the current ASL 311 with a change to CDS and a new name
*         FHS 331: Group and Community Interventions. Title change
*         FHS 330: Individual Interventions in Ecological Contexts. Title change


A large number of courses were approved by the Senate and thus are in an attachment (Full report at https://registrar.uoregon.edu/sites/registrar1.uoregon.edu/files/pdf/uo-curriculum-report-201602-winter-2017.pdf ):

The due date for course submissions for review this spring is April 28th.

Program Review.

*         The Dean of the College of Education, with endorsement by the Associate Vice Provost for Academic Excellence, has approved discontinuing the Education Studies major previously offered by the Department of Education Studies. The major has not been in use since 2007 when the Educational Foundations major was approved, and has no students enrolled in the major. Effective Fall 2017.


*         The Dean of the College of Education, with endorsement by the associate vice provost for academic excellence, has approved discontinuing the bachelor of education in educational foundations offered by the Department of Education Studies. The degree has not been awarded since 2011 and the department no longer advises students to pursue this option.  Students either complete the bachelor of arts or the bachelor of science in educational foundations.  There are currently no students pursuing the bachelor of education. Effective Fall 2017.


The next date for program submissions for review will be in early fall 2017.


Academic Extension
Just a quick reminder to faculty. When you approve an AE course at the department level you are indicating that the course meets your department standards for course content and level of rigor. These courses will be on the participant's transcripts with your department/program prefix and in most cases a graduate credit.
There were two courses approved in winter for Academic Extension:

*         EDLD 608              Building Leadership and Equity Skills to Improve Education Systems II

*         CFT 608 Adolescent Girls and Resilience


EDUC Courses and Requirements
After discussion as a committee and then with the Dean to regarding the EDUC coursework and requirements, The COE CC has requested the Dean create a committee to complete a full review of the courses, policy, and management for EDUC. As a result the COECC also decided to hold on their decision regarding moving EDUC 613 forward for vote.  This means that no Philosophy of Research: Exploring Foundational Questions course will be offered in the fall by EDUC. EDST will offer a course in the fall using the developed syllabi and information about this course is available from Lisa Mazzei or Jerry Rosiek.

Senate Approved Policies

Upon recommendation of the undergraduate council, the Senate approved US16/17-13: Amendment to the Credit-Bearing General Limitations to the Bachelor's Requirements.  Effective Fall 2017.

COE Curriculum Committee and Curriculum Resources
Your committee representatives are listed below. I strongly recommend that you keep them informed of any course or program modifications or additions. The names with * are seats that are open next year. Please consider volunteering for this service.

*         EMPL: Keith Zvoch*, Jo Smith*

*         EDST: Audrey Lucero, Jeanne Hall

*         SPECS: Chris Murray, Angie Whalen*

*         CPHS: Deanna Linville-Knobelspiesse, Kathy Moxley-South*
The COE Curriculum Resources are available on the COE Governance page: https://coedocs.uoregon.edu/display/governance/COE+Governance+and+Policies

On this site you will find such things as:

*         Current syllabi information

*         Approved COE Curriculum policy

*         EDUC courses

*         Calendars of COE program and course process
There are a number of forms and policies that people often look for but have difficulty finding. I have temporarily made a section on the Governance page titles "Forms and Policies" that has some of these. If there are others we should add let Mercedes know (mercedr at uoregon.edu<mailto:mercedr at uoregon.edu>) and we will try and locate and link it.

Coming in Spring 2017


*         Due to policies passed by the UG Council and Graduate Council as well as Senate, in the next 3 years COE will need to submit each course that is taught in hybrid or online format through the UOCC for approval.

*         COECC approved a change to the COE Curriculum Policy and Procedures to reduce the types of course approval to 2 - exempt (approval by Associate Dean) and Full review.  This amendment to the current policy will be distributed for vote in early spring 2017.

Brigid
-------------- next part --------------

URL: <http://lists-prod.uoregon.edu/pipermail/coe-fac/attachments/20170331/ee7d4e86/attachment-0001.html>
'

subject: b'coe-fac: Faculty Regalia Rental and Commencement Information'
html:
b'
Hello,
With the number of new faculty in the COE I thought I would send out a little information on how faculty participate in our Commencement Ceremony.
We encourage any and all faculty to participate.  For those of you who don't own your own regalia, the COE will cover the cost for your rental for our graduation ceremony.  Rental regalia includes standard black gown and the appropriate hood for your Alma Mater. To guarantee exact hood colors please use the link below to make your order by May 5.  After that time it may be necessary to substitute a hood with the closest available colors or Oregon colors.
On the order form, choose the Spring 2017 ceremony.  As the COE covers the cost of renting regalia for the ceremony, choose 'bill department' in the payment area.

Order your regalia here:
http://www.uoduckstore.com/regalia-rental-form

If you had any problems with your regalia last year, please let me know so we can make the necessary corrections.  If you have questions about what you should order, feel free to contact me or the Duck Store regalia expert Stacy Miller at smiller at uoregon.edu<mailto:smiller at uoregon.edu>.
The week prior to graduation, the Duck Store will deliver the regalia to HEDCO 130 and we'll get it distributed to your office.  On graduation day (Monday, June 19), we ask that you show up in your regalia at Matt Knight Arena at 3:15 pm (about 45 minutes before the ceremony begins).  There will be COE staff on hand to show you where to line up and walk in.  There will be a few presentations, we will hood our doctoral students and then the remaining students will cross the stage and shake the dean's hand while their names are read.  The ceremony lasts about 2 hours.
I'll be sending out more specific information with exact times and locations, but feel free to ask me any questions.  I also love talking with students about Commencement, so let me know if I can do any class visits or provide them any information.
Thanks,
Lisa




Lisa Fortin
Director of Events and Student Recruitment
College of Education, University of Oregon
Ph:  541-346-1607

-------------- next part --------------

URL: <http://lists-prod.uoregon.edu/pipermail/coe-fac/attachments/20170331/ff0e4576/attachment.html>

subject: b'coe-fac: RCS: Education and Outreach Opportunities for Spring and Summer 2017 **REMINDER**'
html:
b'
Hello faculty and students,

A reminder of the upcoming workshop on IRB issues specific to conducting research with children and teens for this Wednesday 4/12, from 12-1:30 in Hedco 230T. It should provide very helpful research guidance! Details below and in the attached.

Leslie


***********
Leslie Leve, PhD
Professor and Associate Dean for Research and Faculty Development
College of Education
Associate Director, Prevention Science Institute
University of Oregon

Phone: 541-346-9601
Web: https://education.uoregon.edu/users/leslie-leve

Date: Friday, March 24, 2017 at 8:55 PM
To: "coe-fac at lists.uoregon.edu<mailto:coe-fac at lists.uoregon.edu>" <coe-fac at lists.uoregon.edu<mailto:coe-fac at lists.uoregon.edu>>, "coegr at lists.uoregon.edu<mailto:coegr at lists.uoregon.edu>" <coegr at lists.uoregon.edu<mailto:coegr at lists.uoregon.edu>>
Cc: craig carolyn <craig3 at uoregon.edu<mailto:craig3 at uoregon.edu>>
Subject: RCS: Education and Outreach Opportunities for Spring and Summer 2017

COE faculty and graduate students,

Please see the attached flyer about an IRB workshop focused on conducting research with children and teens, to be held April 12, 12-1:30 in Hedco 230T. This workshop is open to all UO faculty and students, but is especially relevant to our COE research populations. I encourage you to attend if you have some tricky human subjects issues with your study samples and/or you are newer to leading your own research with children.

Registration required, see link below (also see the other workshop offerings below that may be of interest).

Thanks, and have a wonderful spring break!

Leslie

***********
Leslie Leve, PhD
Professor and Associate Dean for Research and Faculty Development
College of Education

University of Oregon

Subject: RCS: Education and Outreach Opportunities for Spring and Summer 2017

Dear UO Research Community,

Research Compliance Services (RCS) has recently posted our workshop offerings for Spring and Summer 2017 and will continue to hold routine office hours.  This term we are offering a special session for those who conduct research with children or teens (see flyer attached!).

Below are some of the planned workshops.  Visit our education and outreach page for more information about our education and outreach program, future offerings, and the current office hours schedule: http://rcs.uoregon.edu/content/education-training.

Upcoming Workshops: *
April 12, 2017, 12:00pm-1:30pm

Human Subject Research Involving Children and Teens<https://odt.uoregon.edu/registration/course_view.php?crse_id=737>

April 18, 2017, 1:00pm-2:30pm

IRB Submission and Protocol Development Workshop<http://odt.uoregon.edu/registration/session_view.php?sess_id=8378>

April 21, 2017, 1:00pm-2:30pm

How to Write a Research Plan for IRB Submission<http://odt.uoregon.edu/registration/session_view.php?sess_id=8381>

May 15, 2017, 11:00am-12:30pm

IRB Submission and Protocol Development Workshop<http://odt.uoregon.edu/registration/session_view.php?sess_id=8379>

May 18, 2017, 11:00am-12:30pm

How to Write a Research Plan for IRB Submission<http://odt.uoregon.edu/registration/session_view.php?sess_id=8383>

August 9, 2017, 10:00am-11:30am

IRB Submission and Protocol Development Workshop<http://odt.uoregon.edu/registration/session_view.php?sess_id=8380>

August 10, 2017, 10:00am-11:30am

How to Write a Research Plan for IRB Submission<http://odt.uoregon.edu/registration/session_view.php?sess_id=8384>

*Click on the workshop links above for more information and to access registration through Making Tracks<http://odt.uoregon.edu/registration/>.

Office Hours: **
Tuesdays, 10 a.m. - 12 p.m.

Wednesdays, 2 p.m. - 4 p.m.

**Find us here<http://rcs.uoregon.edu/content/contact-us>.

As a reminder, we are also available for group and class presentations and available for scheduled consultations.

Please share this message with any of your colleagues and students you think might be interested.   Feel free to contact our office with questions or for more information at (541)346-2510 or researchcompliance at uoregon.edu<mailto:researchcompliance at uoregon.edu>.

Sincerely,
Research Compliance Services
University of Oregon
541-346-2510

subject: b'coe-fac: Tutoring for Spring Term'
html:
b'
The COE offers FREE tutoring to all COE students. Currently, Tutoring Services offers tutoring in APA format, academic writing, English as a second language, math, science, and CDS courses - please see below for more specific descriptions. We offer drop-in hours, one-on-one tutoring appointments and online writing tutoring.
More information about tutoring, including current drop-in hours are listed below and on our webpage: education.uoregon.edu/tutors <http://education.uoregon.edu/tutors>
NEW ONLINE Writing Tutoring
If you have a paper you'd like to be looked over by a tutor, you can either schedule an an appointment at coe.uoregon.edu/tutor/<http://coe.uoregon.edu/tutor> by selecting ONLINE WRITING Tutoring in the drop-down menu. From there, the tutor will send you instructions on how to proceed. This is not a skype session, rather the tutor will look over your paper and provide comments back to you by the end of the appointment time you selected. If none of the times on the schedule work, you can email coetutor at uoregon.edu to request an online appointment.

Current Drop-in Hours in the HEDCO Learning Commons

Academic Writing
Monday: 1:00 - 4:00 with Sarina
Tuesday: 12:00 - 2:00 with Tani
Wednesday: 12:00 - 2:00 with Tani
Friday: 9:45 - 11:45 with Sarina

Linguistics and CDS
Tuesday: 12:00 - 2:00 with Tani
Wednesday: 12:00 - 2:00 with Tani

General Math and Science
Monday: 1:00 - 4:00 with Sarina
Friday: 9:45 - 11:45 with Sarina

Math 211/212/213
Tuesday: 12:00 - 2:00 with Zixin
Wednesday: 2:00 - 4:00 with Zixin




Lisa Fortin
Director of Events and Student Recruitment
College of Education, University of Oregon
Ph:  541-346-1607

subject: b'coe-fac: College of Education Graduate Council seat open - ACTION NEEDED BY FRIDAY'
html:
b'
Dear College of Education Faculty:


It has been my pleasure to represent the College for the past three years on the Graduate Council.  My term ends this June, and so we have a vacancy to fill. To be considered for election to this seat, please enter your name into the Senate service survey (see original email below) by tomorrow.


The Council meets monthly and advises the Dean and Associate Dean of the Graduate School on all matters related to graduate training as well as reviewing new curriculum and program proposals.  The Council has been extremely thoughtful and considerate, and has promoted important decisions this year related to graduate student funding, curriculum quality, student safety, and service loads for Directors of Graduate Studies. The Council works with the UO Curriculum Committee, Senate and other administrative units. The position is appropriate for teaching faculty at all ranks.


Please enter your name if this is a position to which you'd like to be elected. Thank you for considering it!


Best,

Krista


_______________________________________________________________
Krista M. Chronister, PhD
Associate Professor, Counseling Psychology
Assistant Dean for Equity and Inclusion, College of Education
5251 University of Oregon
Eugene, OR 97403-5251
Off:   541-346-2415
Fax:  541-346-6778
http://www.access-dv.org/




From: Senate VP <senatevp at uoregon.edu<mailto:senatevp at uoregon.edu>>
Date: Wednesday, April 19, 2017 at 12:40 PM
Subject: Committee vacancies for next year

Dear Senators and ex-officio members of the Senate:

  We need your help in recruiting for a small handful of committee seats for next year.  As you may know, the Committee on Committees appoints individuals to a large number of committees during Spring term.  For the last few weeks we have  asked faculty members (and members of other constituencies) to fill out the election survey and specify which committees they are interested in serving on.  While the survey is officially closed, individuals can still submit their preferences via the following link.

Link to survey:  https://blogs.uoregon.edu/senate/election-survey/

  We'd like to draw your particular attention to those seats for which we have no current nominations (see below).  Please forward the names of colleagues you think may be appropriate for any of these positions and we will contact them to see if they are interested.

Thank you on behalf of the Committee on Committees,

--
Chris Sinclair
UO Senate VP
University of Oregon

subject: b'coe-fac: Faculty Professional Development Funds Available - Applications Due June 1 and January 1'
html:
b'
Sent on behalf of Randy Kamphaus

Dear Faculty,

I continue to be impressed with the professional development activities in which you engage to advance the quality and reach of your scholarship and teaching. I want to further support these activities. I am providing Faculty Professional Development funds for which all College faculty may apply. A total of $2,500 may be requested each academic year. Applications will be accepted January 1 and June 1.  Applications for expenses that have been incurred within the last 6 months may be reimbursed. Funding priority is given to professional development activities that advance your research productivity and/or teaching quality.

To apply, please click on the link below.

https://coe.uoregon.edu/facultyfundawards/request-for-professional-development-funds/

Thank you,
Randy

For scheduling, please contact Maggie Bosworth at  magboz at uoregon.edu<mailto:%20magboz at uoregon.edu> or 541-346-6467.
________________________________
[COE logo]

R.W. Kamphaus, Ph.D. | Professor and Dean
randyk at uoregon.edu<mailto:randyk at uoregon.edu> | 541-346-3405
HEDCO 130
1215 University of Oregon | Eugene, OR 97403

text:
b'Sent on behalf of Randy Kamphaus

Dear Faculty,

I continue to be impressed with the professional development activities in which you engage to advance the quality and reach of your scholarship and teaching. I want to further support these activities. I am providing Faculty Professional Development funds for which all College faculty may apply. A total of $2,500 may be requested each academic year. Applications will be accepted January 1 and June 1.  Applications for expenses that have been incurred within the last 6 months may be reimbursed. Funding priority is given to professional development activities that advance your research productivity and/or teaching quality.

To apply, please click on the link below.

https://coe.uoregon.edu/facultyfundawards/request-for-professional-development-funds/

Thank you,
Randy

For scheduling, please contact Maggie Bosworth at  magboz at uoregon.edu<mailto:%20magboz at uoregon.edu> or 541-346-6467.
________________________________
[COE logo]

R.W. Kamphaus, Ph.D. | Professor and Dean
randyk at uoregon.edu<mailto:randyk at uoregon.edu> | 541-346-3405
HEDCO 130
1215 University of Oregon | Eugene, OR 97403

subject: b'coe-fac: Faculty Regalia for Commencement'
html:
b'
Hello,
Below is the current list of faculty who have ordered regalia for commencement.  Today is the cut off for you to order rental regalia and be guaranteed of your hood color.  After today it may be necessary to substitute a hood with the closest available colors or Oregon colors.  If you still need to order regalia  you can do so at:  http://www.uoduckstore.com/regalia-rental-form
On the order form, choose the Spring 2017 ceremony.  As the COE covers the cost of renting regalia for the ceremony, choose 'bill department' in the payment area.
Let me know if you have any questions.
Lisa

subject: b'coe-fac: FW: IRB Application Workshops 5/15 & 5/18'
html:
b'
Dear COE faculty and graduate students,

Please see details below for two workshops on IRB protocol development and the IRB application process. If you are new to the UO's IRB process and are planning a research project that involves human subjects, I highly recommend participation in one or both of these sessions.

Thanks,
Leslie



***********
Leslie Leve, PhD
Professor and Associate Dean for Research and Faculty Development
College of Education
Associate Director, Prevention Science Institute
University of Oregon

Phone: 541-346-9601
Web: https://education.uoregon.edu/users/leslie-leve

[Macintosh HD:Users:tjordan:Documents:current-jobs:__UO branding main:__UO Brand Elements Jun15:UO Business Papers:Electronic letterhead:UO Secondary Sig LH:UO Digital LH - COE:COE-3435-CGY11-4C.png]


From: "Research edu>" <researchcompliance at uoregon.edu<mailto:researchcompliance at uoregon.edu>>
Date: Wednesday, May 10, 2017 at 9:39 AM
To: craig carolyn <craig3 at uoregon.edu<mailto:craig3 at uoregon.edu>>, Caitlin Alcorn <calcorn at uoregon.edu<mailto:calcorn at uoregon.edu>>
Subject: IRB Application Workshops 5/15 & 5/18

Dear Colleagues,

As you may have heard, Research Compliance Services is now offering workshops on the IRB application process and protocol development. We have two more workshops scheduled before the end of the term.  We are reaching out to you in hopes you can help spread the word - please distribute widely!

May 15, 2017, 11:00am-12:30pm

IRB Submission and Protocol Development Workshop<http://odt.uoregon.edu/registration/session_view.php?sess_id=8379>

May 18, 2017, 11:00am-12:30pm

How to Write a Research Plan for IRB Submission<http://odt.uoregon.edu/registration/session_view.php?sess_id=8383>

*Click on the workshop links above for more information and to access registration through Making Tracks<http://odt.uoregon.edu/registration/>.

As a reminder, we are also holding regular office hours on Tuesdays from 10 a.m.-12p.m. and Wednesdays from 2 p.m. - 4 p.m.

Please share this message with any of your colleagues and students you think might be interested.   Feel free to contact our office with questions or for more information at (541)346-2510 or researchcompliance at uoregon.edu<mailto:researchcompliance at uoregon.edu>.

Thank you!

Caitlin Alcorn, CIP and Carolyn Craig, PhD, CIP
Sr. Research Compliance Administrators
calcorn at uoregon.edu<mailto:calcorn at uoregon.edu>
craig3 at uoregon.edu<mailto:craig3 at uoregon.edu>
http://rcs.uoregon.edu/

subject: b'coe-fac: Faculty Attending Graduation'
html:
b'
Hello,
Graduation is just a few weeks away and we're finalizing our details for the ceremony.  Below is the list of faculty I currently have participating in commencement.  Please take a look at the list to see if I have your information correct and send me changes by Wednesday, May 31.

1)      If you aren't on the list and plan on being there, let me know so I can make sure we have enough seats for the faculty

2)      If there is nothing in the 'ordered regalia' column, then the Duck Store doesn't have an order for you as of today.  If you need to order rental regalia (paid for by the COE) do so here as soon as you can:  http://www.uoduckstore.com/regalia-rental-form

3)      I have noted who will be hooding our PhD and DEd students.  Please let me know if I've got that wrong.

If your information is correct, you need do nothing but come and enjoy commencement.  Regalia will be delivered to HEDCO 130 the week of June 12th and I'll let you know when it can be picked up.  I'll also provide additional information to the platform party, hooding faculty and everyone else that week.  Let me know if you have questions before then.

Thanks for your patience!
Lisa

subject: b'coe-fac: TTF Workload Policy'
html:
b'
The following message is sent on behalf of Dean Randy Kamphaus:

Dear TTF Faculty,

Attached, please find the version of the TTF Workload Policy that I will submit to Academic Affairs for their approval next week. I am including both a clean version and a marked-up version so that the most recent changes are evident.

To review, the policy was voted on (March 27th). I have since revised it based on comments provided by COE faculty during the voting period as well as on guidance provided by University leadership.

The TTF workload committee also had an opportunity to read this version and have shared their comments with me via Leslie Leve (committee chair). I made additional changes based on that feedback.

Per Academic Affairs guidance, the next step for me is to hold an open forum on Friday June 9th for all TTF from 11:00 - 12:00 in 230T to discuss the revisions and their rationale.  At this forum, I will speak to issues such as: (a) the history of the "standard load" section as it changed from the original proposal of 3 courses, to 5 courses, and now to 4 - 5 courses per academic year, (b) responding to faculty concerns about the course cancellation and "make up" proposal, (c) Department Head and Faculty Advisory Committee infusion of our core research mission into the standard course load definition, and (d) inclusion of the minimum course credit requirements per academic year.

As usual, our faculty burnished their reputations as devoted servants of our college by dedicating countless hours to this work. For that service, I am most grateful.

I look forward to seeing you on the 9th.

Regards,

--Randy
c Academic Affairs, Provost Coltrane, COE Staff

subject: b'coe-fac: Faculty at COE Commencement'
html:
b'
Hello,
I hope everyone is looking forward to Commencement.  Attached are instructions for faculty participation and a map that shows you the line-up area at the lower level of Matt Knight Arena.  Below is the list of faculty I have who've notified me that they are participating.  If you are not on this list, but plan on being there, no worries!  You can send me an email to let me know, but really, you just need to show up at 3:30 pm on the big day and join the faculty line up.
I'll let you know next week when the regalia has arrived for those that ordered it from the Duck Store.
Please let me know if you have any questions.
Thanks,
Lisa

text:
b"Hello,
I hope everyone is looking forward to Commencement.  Attached are instructions for faculty participation and a map that shows you the line-up area at the lower level of Matt Knight Arena.  Below is the list of faculty I have who've notified me that they are participating.  If you are not on this list, but plan on being there, no worries!  You can send me an email to let me know, but really, you just need to show up at 3:30 pm on the big day and join the faculty line up.
I'll let you know next week when the regalia has arrived for those that ordered it from the Duck Store.
Please let me know if you have any questions.
Thanks,
Lisa

subject: b'coe-fac: ObaVerse and Instructional design'
html:
b'
The following message is sent on behalf of the Oba Team:
---
"Hey all -
As part of our evolution towards more research-based endeavors within the COE, from December 13, 2017 we will no longer be able to offer direct tech support / instructional design for your ObaVerse courses.
Beyond this date, you will be able to continue to use the same free version of ObaVerse you're used to for your courses (think of us as YouTube, Evernote, Google Docs, Dropbox etc).
We'll be continuing to focus on developing Oba and other digital tools for internal and external research projects, schools, and nonprofit organizations. So if you have any upcoming grant funded research projects that would benefit from some super-cool technology and expertise in digital learning, just let us know! :)
Dane & Sol"


Thank you, we will follow-up with additional information.



J. Chris Krabiel
College of Education
P: 541-346-6913
[cid:image001.gif at 01CE1104.B9070730]

html:
b'

No matter how you return it, please do so by the end of the week.

Thanks,

Lisa

subject: b"coe-fac: Don't Miss Funding Opportunities: Join AERA"
html:
b'
Greetings ROC and COE Faculty~

The following message is forwarded to you on behalf of Dr. Ed Kame'enui, Associate Dean for Research and Faculty Development. This message is a follow-up email previously sent to the ROC on 8/09/2017:

From: AERA Membership <reply at aeramail.org<mailto:reply at aeramail.org>>
Reply-To: "reply at aeramail.org<mailto:reply at aeramail.org>" <reply at aeramail.org<mailto:reply at aeramail.org>>
Date: Friday, August 11, 2017 at 8:57 AM
To: Ed Kame enui <ekamee at uoregon.edu<mailto:ekamee at uoregon.edu>>
Subject: Don't Miss Funding Opportunities: Join AERA

[http://www.aeramail.org/UserFiles/c_78/Image/AERA%20Logo_2017_Final%20SMALL.jpg]<http://www.aeramail.org/l.jsp?d=2938.414071.78.4uN0ndis.A>

Join<http://www.aeramail.org/l.jsp?d=2938.414072.78.4uN0ndis.A> AERA and receive our monthly electronic newsletter, AERA Highlights. This month's Highlights notified members, as always, of funding opportunities with a call for Dissertation Grants of up to $20,000 for one year projects; Call for Research Grants for up to $20,000 for one year projects or $35,000 for two year projects; Call for Education Research Conference Proposals with awards up to $35,000; and AERA Calls for editors for 2019 and 2021 Review of Research in Education.

Receive Educational Researcher and another of AERA's top ranked journals back to January 1, 2017. Other member benefits include a video library of professional development opportunities via the AERA Virtual Learning Center; AERA Job Board; discounts on books, and insurance. Most importantly, volunteer and engage with your community found among the 12 Divisions and 151 Special Interest Groups where you can develop deeper relationships with your colleagues to inspire, support, and advance you in the field.

Join<http://www.aeramail.org/l.jsp?d=2938.414073.78.4uN0ndis.A> for the 2017 membership year today online<http://www.aeramail.org/l.jsp?d=2938.414069.78.4uN0ndis.A>. Note "Forgot your user name" and "Forgot your password" options on the login page<http://www.aeramail.org/l.jsp?d=2938.414070.78.4uN0ndis.A> to reset them. If you are not sure if you have a user name and password, select the button below the login called "Activate or Create My Account." For activating your account, provide your contact ID # 35434, your first and last name, and follow prompts."

For assistance contact the AERA membership team at members at aera.net<mailto:members at aera.net> or 202-238-3200 and provide your contact ID # 35434.
________________________________
This email was sent to ekamee at uoregon.edu<mailto:ekamee at uoregon.edu>. You are receiving this email because of your association with AERA. Click the following link to change your preference or opt out of AERA emails: preferences<http://www.aeramail.org/util/opt_out.jsp?e=3HAdVkrWGYlMPxlXIIisnGRFGmHE.A&s=4uN0ndis.A&v=5pnXyNsfTr0bpR1J_lTQIWg..A>

American Educational Research Association
1430 K Street, NW, Suite 1200
Washington, DC 20005
www.aera.net<http://www.aera.net>


Mercedes Rathswohl
Dean's Office Administrative Assistant
Faculty and Staff Services, College of Education
HEDCO 230
541-346-7965

subject: b'coe-fac: FW: RCS: Education and Outreach Opportunities for Fall 2017'
text:
b'The following message is sent on behalf of Ed Kame'enui, Associate Dean for Research and Faculty Development:

From: "Research edu>" <researchcompliance at uoregon.edu<mailto:researchcompliance at uoregon.edu>>
Date: Friday, August 25, 2017 at 10:19 AM
To: "Research edu>" <researchcompliance at uoregon.edu<mailto:researchcompliance at uoregon.edu>>
Subject: RCS: Education and Outreach Opportunities for Fall 2017

Dear UO Research Community,

Research Compliance Services (RCS) has recently posted our workshop offerings for Fall 2017 and will continue to hold routine office hours this term.  Below are some of the planned workshops. Please share this message with any of your colleagues and students you think might be interested.  We also have a flyer attached that you are welcome to pass along and/or post.

Visit our education and outreach page for more information about our education and outreach program, future offerings, and the current office hours schedule: http://rcs.uoregon.edu/content/education-training.

Upcoming Fall Workshops:*
IRB Submission and Protocol Development <https://odt.uoregon.edu/registration/course_view.php?crse_id=699>



September 13, 2017<https://odt.uoregon.edu/registration/registration_add.php?sess_id=8754>

How to Write Research Plan<https://odt.uoregon.edu/registration/course_view.php?crse_id=701>



September 14, 2017<https://odt.uoregon.edu/registration/registration_add.php?sess_id=8755>

IRB Training for New Faculty & OA's<https://odt.uoregon.edu/registration/course_view.php?crse_id=700>



October 12, 2017<https://odt.uoregon.edu/registration/registration_add.php?sess_id=8756>

RCR Training for New Faculty & OA's<https://odt.uoregon.edu/registration/course_view.php?crse_id=702>



October 19, 2017<https://odt.uoregon.edu/registration/registration_add.php?sess_id=8759>

FCOI Training for New Faculty & OA's<https://odt.uoregon.edu/registration/course_view.php?crse_id=703>



October 26, 2017<https://odt.uoregon.edu/registration/registration_add.php?sess_id=8760>

IRB Submission and Protocol Development <https://odt.uoregon.edu/registration/course_view.php?crse_id=699>



November 15, 2017<https://odt.uoregon.edu/registration/registration_add.php?sess_id=8758>

How to Write Research Plan<https://odt.uoregon.edu/registration/course_view.php?crse_id=701>



November 16, 2017<https://odt.uoregon.edu/registration/registration_add.php?sess_id=8757>

*Click on the workshop links above for more information and to access registration through Making Tracks<http://odt.uoregon.edu/registration/>.

Office Hours Fall 2017:**
Tuesday, 10 a.m. - 12 p.m.

Wednesday, 2 p.m. - 4 p.m.

**Find us here<http://rcs.uoregon.edu/content/contact-us>.

As a reminder, we are also available for group and class presentations and available for scheduled consultations.

Feel free to contact our office with questions or for more information at (541)346-2510 or researchcompliance at uoregon.edu<mailto:researchcompliance at uoregon.edu>.

Sincerely,
Research Compliance Services
University f Oregon
541-346-2510


Mercedes Rathswohl
Dean's Office Administrative Assistant
Faculty and Staff Services, College of Education
HEDCO 230
541-346-7965

subject: b'coe-fac: Hello from the UO Libraries'
html:
b'
Hello all,


I am the subject librarian for the College of Education. As we're nearing the start of a new academic year, I'd just like to quickly remind you of some of the ways that I (and the UO Libraries) can support you and your students.


*         Instruction sessions on research and library resources for your class

*         One-on-one or small group research consultations for you or your students. Schedule an appointment with me here (http://uoregon.libcal.com/appointment/24599) or shoot me an email to set up a time.

*         I welcome your suggestions for purchases for the library collection, particularly for items like books, DVDs, etc. (items with a one-time cost). I also manage the curriculum (K-12 textbook) and juvenile collections if you have any suggestions for these areas.

*         I maintain research guides<http://researchguides.uoregon.edu/prf.php?account_id=121286> for some of the departments/programs in COE. These should automatically appear as a tab on your Canvas course site (that you can toggle on or off as you like).

*         Citation management help - I have experience with Zotero and Mendeley in particular but am up for tackling any of your citation management tool related questions.

*         Have questions about course reserves, your Canvas course site, digital scholarship support, or other services managed by our library? I can point you in the right direction or get you in touch with the library staff person who can help you.


Let me know if you any questions, suggestions, or other ideas about how the library could support you and your students. I hope you have a good fall term!


Best,

Katherine

--
Katherine S. Donaldson
Social Sciences/Education Librarian
University of Oregon Libraries
1299 University of Oregon
Eugene, OR 97403-1299
Phone: 541-346-4132
kdonalds at uoregon.edu<mailto:kdonalds at uoregon.edu>

-------------- next part --------------
An HTML attachment was scrubbed...
URL: <http://lists-prod.uoregon.edu/pipermail/coe-fac/attachments/20170918/bde462b1/attachment.html>
'

subject: b'coe-fac: Reminder:  Convocation tomorrow at Matt Knight Arena'
html:
b'
Hello everyone -

subject: b'coe-fac: FW: Save the date for upcoming workshops - Faculty Merit Review and Processing Tenure Files'
html:
b'
Greetings COE Faculty~

The following message is forwarded to you on behalf of Ed Kame'enui, Associate Dean for Research and Faculty Development:

From: Academic Affairs Office of <academicaffairs at uoregon.edu<mailto:academicaffairs at uoregon.edu>>
Date: Wednesday, September 27, 2017 at 2:11 PM
Subject: Save the date for upcoming workshops - Faculty Merit Review and Processing Tenure Files

Dear Colleagues,

The Office of the Provost and Academic Affairs is in the process of developing its 2017-18 workshop series based on feedback we heard from you at this year's Summit for Academic Leaders. The full listing of OPAA's fall workshops will be announced soon on Around the O - Workplace and posted on the Academic Affairs website.

In the meantime, please save the date for the following fast approaching workshops for academic leaders and unit managers.

Best Practices for Faculty Merit Review
October 11 - 8:30 - 10:30 AM
Ford Alumni Center - Ballroom

This workshop offers an opportunity for interactive discussion about the upcoming faculty merit review process, including lessons learned during previous review cycles and best practices going forward. Ensure that your unit is ready for an efficient and effective 2017 merit cycle. Representatives from the Office of the Provost and Academic Affairs and Human Resources will be on hand to answer questions and guide the discussion.

Unit heads, assistant, associate and divisional deans, and other academic leaders are encouraged to attend. Please register online<https://odt.uoregon.edu/registration/registration_add.php?sess_id=8938> no later than October 9.

Processing Tenure Files
October 25 - 8:30 - 10:30 AM
Knight Library - Browsing room

Ensure that faculty in your unit are on track for successful navigation of the tenure process and that you are prepared to play your part. This workshop will provide a nuts and bolts overview of the tenure timeline and process, as well as an interactive discussion around how to support faculty members going up for tenure. Representatives from the Office of the Provost and Academic Affairs will be on hand to answer questions and guide the discussion.

Unit heads and managers are encouraged to attend. Please register online<https://odt.uoregon.edu/registration/registration_add.php?sess_id=8939> no later than October 23.

We look forward to seeing you soon.

Cheers,

Sierra Dawson
Assistant Vice Provost for Academic Affairs


Mercedes Rathswohl
Dean's Office Administrative Assistant
Faculty and Staff Services, College of Education
HEDCO 230
541-346-7965
mercedr at uoregon.edu<mailto:mercedr at uoregon.edu>

subject: b'coe-fac: FW: LEARN Coalition - Memo on I Report from the Commission on Evidence-Based Policymaking and nominations for IES Board'
html:
b'
Greetings Faculty~

The following message and attached memo are forwarded on behalf of Ed Kame'enui, Associate Dean for Research and Faculty Development:

From: Blanchi Roblero <broblero at pennhillgroup.com<mailto:broblero at pennhillgroup.com>>
Sent: Friday, September 29, 2017 12:23 PM
To: Alex Nock; Vic Klatt; Blanchi Roblero
Subject: LEARN Coalition - Memo on l Report from the Commission on Evidence-Based Policymaking and nominations for IES Board

LEARN coalition - As a follow up to our in person meeting attached is a high-level memo on the Commission on Evidence- Based Policymaking's final report.

Additionally, as mentioned in our meeting there are currently vacancies in the National Board for Education Sciences Board in IES. The Board is composed of prominent researchers, school administrators, and business executives, please let us know if there are any individuals you would like to recommend for LEARN to nominate.

Best,
Blanchi

subject: b'coe-fac: Education Week'
html:
b'
Hello COE faculty,

Before Katy Lenn transitioned to being head of the Library's Research and Instructional Services Department, she had started looking into pricing for the online version of Education Week. We currently have access to the online version<https://alliance-primo.hosted.exlibrisgroup.com/UO:uo_alma:CP71185687030001451> of the print edition of Education Week. As some of you may know who have personal accounts on the Education Week site, there is a lot of online only content that is not included in our current subscription.

I have taken over communicating with the vendor about this particular resource and was hoping to gather some feedback from COE faculty who might be interested in this resource. Please send me a quick email if this is something you'd like me to consider purchasing.

Thanks,
Katherine


--
Katherine S. Donaldson
Social Sciences/Education Librarian
University of Oregon Libraries
1299 University of Oregon
Eugene, OR 97403-1299
Phone: 541-346-4132
kdonalds at uoregon.edu<mailto:kdonalds at uoregon.edu>

subject: b'coe-fac: Faculty Merit Review Process 2017'
html:
b'
Dear COE Faculty,
The 2017-2018 merit review process is now underway. The process for eligible faculty will be the same process that was undertaken last year. The timeframe, materials, and process for eligible faculty are described below.
[Note: The process steps described below apply to eligible faculty only. Pro tem, adjunct, and visiting faculty members, retired faculty members in appointments outside of the TRP program, and postdoctoral scholars are ineligible.  For OAs, merit review process is based on the OA merit policy. Eligible UO OAs received an email dated 9.27.17 from the VPFA describing the OA process and timeline.]

Faculty Merit process:
Department and Unit Heads will submit merit recommendations to the Dean's office. The Dean's office will make final decisions regarding merit. Merit increases will take effect January 1st 2018. Please review the information below and send the requested materials to your Department or Unit Heads by October 31, 2017.



Timeframe:

*         The period of the current 2017 merit review extends back to the last performance assessment end date (which was October 31st, 2016), and runs through October 31st 2017. So, materials, productivity, and faculty activity dated from November 1, 2016, will be included in the current merit review.

Materials to submit:

*         An updated curriculum vita - in which you use the highlight function (directly applied to any activity, productivity, service, teaching, etc.) to highlight updates to the November 2016 - October, 2017, time period.

*         A one-page Personal Statement in which you may communicate anything about your teaching, research, service, and/or other professional activity during the November 2016 - October, 2017 period that you would like to highlight as part of your Merit Review.

Review Process:

*         Unit or Department Merit Review Committees or Unit Directors or Department Heads, in conjunction with the Internal Governance Policies of the unit, will review the materials identified above in making Merit recommendations to the Dean of the College of Education. If a faculty member has multiple appointments the faculty member will submit materials to both unit or department head(s) as appropriate.  If the duties in each appointment are identical, the administrators involved may collaborate on the merit recommendation.

*         Materials described above to be included in the 2017 faculty Merit Review are due to your Department or Unit Head by October 31, 2017.



Best,
Dianna

Dianna Carrizales-Engelmann, Ph.D.,

Director of Administration
College of Education
1215 University of Oregon
(541) 346-5407

-------------- next part --------------
An HTML attachment was scrubbed...
URL: <http://lists-prod.uoregon.edu/pipermail/coe-fac/attachments/20171012/f40d477b/attachment.html>
'

subject: b'coe-fac: Your feedback requested on new LibrarySearch Beta interface'
html:
b'
Dear COE Faculty and Staff,


The UO Libraries' online catalog interface called LibrarySearch will change to a new, upgraded version during winter break, between December 11-23, 2017. While the underlying search functionality will remain the same in the new version, UO Libraries is soliciting feedback from the UO community regarding experiences using the new interface. We are gathering and considering comments during Fall Term 2017.

The new interface's design was informed by results of user studies performed by the vendor. Some of the benefits of the new interface include:

  *   Enhanced usability (based on users' feedback)
  *   Responsive, mobile-friendly design
  *   Improved accessibility, i.e., compliance with Section 508 and WCAG 2.0 AA standards
  *   Modern design; less cluttered

We invite you to provide feedback on the new LibrarySearch Beta interface<https://alliance-primo-sb.hosted.exlibrisgroup.com/primo-explore/search?vid=UO&lang=en_US&sortby=rank&tab=default_tab>. There is a link on each page of the catalog that will allow you to respond, or you can use this form<https://oregon.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_4SktAK5aP13RQzz>.

Please note that LibrarySearch Beta does not currently support saving items to your personal lists, but that feature will be enabled when implemented in Winter Term 2018.


If you have any questions about this process or the new interface, please let me know.



Thank you,

Katherine

--
Katherine S. Donaldson
Social Sciences/Education Librarian
University of Oregon Libraries
1299 University of Oregon
Eugene, OR 97403-1299
Phone: 541-346-4132
kdonalds at uoregon.edu<mailto:kdonalds at uoregon.edu>?


-------------- next part --------------

URL: <http://lists-prod.uoregon.edu/pipermail/coe-fac/attachments/20171013/9ad7ee1f/attachment.html>

subject: b'coe-fac: FW: Help Spread the Word - Clark Honors College Course\tProposals'
html:
b'
Sent on behalf of the Clark Honors College

It is that time of year when the Clark Honors College solicits course proposals from faculty across campus for the 2018-19 academic year. If you\xe2\x80\x99re not familiar with the CHC, we are an undergraduate-only college, and our curriculum replaces UO general education requirements. You can think of us as GedEd Honors. We have 800 students from all available majors across the university, and many of our students also pursue honors tracks within their major departments.

The college has 25 Core Faculty, and each year we also bring on a cohort of 40-50 Affiliated Faculty. It is the 2018-19 Affiliated Faculty cohort that we are recruiting for now. Course proposals are welcome from all faculty from across all colleges and fields at UO.

Complete details about course requirements and the application process are available on our website<http://honors.uoregon.edu/content/submit-course-proposal>. Applications are due November 10th. Some additional helpful resources:


  *   Examples of CHC Courses<http://honors.uoregon.edu/courses>
  *   2017-18 Affiliated Faculty Cohort<http://honors.uoregon.edu/affiliated-faculty>

CHC Assistant Dean Rebecca Lindner will be reaching out directly to Deans and Department Heads to alert them to this opportunity.

-------------- next part --------------
An HTML attachment was scrubbed...
URL: <http://lists-prod.uoregon.edu/pipermail/coe-fac/attachments/20171024/65fa3cdd/attachment.html>
'

subject: b'coe-fac: COE Scholarship Information - Slide for your Lectures'
html:
b'
COE Teaching Faculty,

The COE was able to give over $640,000 to over 100 COE students this academic year. Currently, the COE is accepting applications for scholarships that will be distributed in 2018-19. It's important that all our students are aware of the funding opportunities available to them. Please consider inserting the attached PowerPoint slide regarding available scholarship funding from the COE to your lecture slides at the beginning or end of your classes from now until January 18, 2018.

The slide contains information about our upcoming information sessions on November 28 and January 9. However, I am also available to speak your class or speak to your cohort about our scholarship application process. Please contact me to schedule.

If you have any questions about who is eligible or the process for applying, don't hesitate to contact me.
Thanks!
~Andrea
________________________________

subject: b'coe-fac: FW: Call for Applications: 2018 NIDA Diversity Scholars\tNetwork dsp'
html:
b'
Hello ROC and COE Faculty,

The following message and attachment are forwarded to you on behalf of Ed Kame'enui, Associate Dean for Research and Faculty Development:

From: "Avila, Albert (NIH/NIDA) [E]" <aavila at nida.nih.gov<mailto:aavila at nida.nih.gov>>
Date: Tuesday, November 7, 2017 at 12:04 PM
To: "Avila, Albert (NIH/NIDA) [E]" <aavila at nida.nih.gov<mailto:aavila at nida.nih.gov>>
Subject: Call for Applications: 2018 NIDA Diversity Scholars Network dsp

Greetings,

Please find attached an announcement for the 2018 NIDA Diversity Scholars Network (NDSN): A Mentoring and Grantsmanship Professional Development Program. The NDSN is a competitive, rigorous, and comprehensive program aimed at enhancing the funding success of outstanding underrepresented early-stage investigators conducting drug abuse research.

The NDSN program consists of two sessions and an interim proposal development period that will support a cohort of scholars in applying for a NIH research grant or equivalent funding in order to build a sustainable independent research career.
APPLICATION DEADLINE:  January 12, 2018

The attached announcement contains additional program details, eligibility, workshop locations, and application information.

Please share this announcement broadly with investigators conducting substance abuse research.

Feel free to contact Albert Avila at aavila at nida.nih.gov<mailto:aavila at nida.nih.gov> with questions.

Thank you,

Albert Avila, Ph.D.
Director, Office of Diversity and Health Disparities
National Institute on Drug Abuse, NIH/DHHS
aavila at nida.nih.gov<mailto:aavila at mail.nih.gov>




Anna Wilson | Assistant to Krista Chronister and Ed Kameenui
Administrative Assistant, College of Education
Office of the Dean | HEDCO 130
Phone: 541-346-6592
Email: aewilson at uoregon.edu<mailto:aewilson at uoregon.edu>

subject: b'coe-fac: COE Career Non-Tenure Track Faculty (CNTTF) Promotion Committee for the 2017-2018 AY'
html:
b'
Hello ROC group and COE Faculty,

The following message is being sent to you on behalf of Ed Kame\xe2\x80\x99enui, Associate Dean for Research and Faculty Development:

________________________________
Greetings,

I am pleased to announce that the Dean has approved the COE Career Non-Tenure Track Faculty (CNTTF) Promotion Committee for the 2017-2018 AY. Faculty nominations were solicited from across the full-range of faculty in the COE.

The CNTTF Promotion Committee is comprised of 9 members, of which 5 are CNTTF from across the academic departments and research and outreach units in the COE\xe2\x80\x94our policy requires no less than 50% of the committee to include CNTTF. The committee also includes 3 tenure-track faculty. I want to congratulate and thank the members for their willingness to serve on this important committee.

The COE Career Non-Tenure Track Faculty (CNTTF) Promotion Committee for the 2017-2018 AY is comprised of the following faculty representatives:

TTF Academic Units

  1.  SPECS: Sylvia Thompson
  2.  EMPL: Keith Zvoch

CNTTF Academic Units

  1.  SPECS: Jantina Clifford
  2.  EDST: Abby Lane
  3.  CPHS: Surendra Subramani

CNTTF Research Units

  1.  Heather McClure, CEQP
  2.  Charlotte Alverson, DESTINY

Academic/Research Units

  1.  CPHS/CPAN TTF: Jeff Todahl
  2.  BRT/EMPL CNTTF: Julie Alonzo

The CNTTF Promotion Committee is currently scheduled to consider 4 cases for promotion (3 cases from research & outreach units and 1 case from the academic departments).

Our general timeline at this point is to begin to finalize files with the intent of making them available for external reviewers, if appropriate, beginning on November 15, 2017. We anticipate department or unit reviews to begin in January 2018, with cases submitted to the FPC in February 2018. Candidates are typically scheduled to meet with the Dean beginning in March 2018, with final dossiers forwarded to the Office of Academic Affairs by April 1, 2018.

I will be contacting members of the COE Career Non-Tenure Track Faculty (CNTTF) Promotion Committee soon to schedule our first meeting.

All the best,
Ed Kame\xe2\x80\x99enui


Anna Wilson | Assistant to Krista Chronister and Ed Kame\xe2\x80\x99enui
Administrative Assistant, College of Education
Office of the Dean | HEDCO 130
Phone: 541-346-6592
Email: aewilson at uoregon.edu<mailto:aewilson at uoregon.edu>
