text:
b'
Dear faculty,

wishing your fall term is starting up successfully!

If relevant, and appropriate for your students enrolled in your courses/programs, please consider sharing this tutoring opportunity for fall term (and the whole academic year) at the Center on Teaching and Learning (CTL) housed in the HEDCO Clinic.

Undergraduate students and graduate students from the College of Education at the University of Oregon are encouraged to apply to tutor at the CTL Clinic. Tutors will gain valuable experience planning and delivering research-based reading or math instruction to K-2nd grade students, monitoring their academic progress, and writing weekly progress reports and a summary report to parents. The clinic is a great site to complete field experience hours. Tutors can expect to spend 4 hours per week to earn 1 credit at the clinic. Of those four hours, tutors will work face-to-face with an assigned individual or group of students for two 50-minute sessions a week.  Remaining time will be dedicated to lesson preparation, data summary for parents, and ongoing feedback/training sessions with an assigned supervisor. U of O students who wish to work more hours at the clinic (e.g. 6-7 hours a week for 2 credits) can be assigned to tutor for two hours 2 days per week or one hour 4 days per week. Tutors may apply for a single term or tutor for multiple terms.

Our Reading and Math Intervention Assessment and Intervention Clinic offers group and individual tutoring services for school-age children (currently, kindergarten - 2nd grade) who are struggling in the areas of reading or math due to learning and attention difficulties and disabilities, including dyslexia and dyscalculia. Our trained, supervised undergraduate and graduate student tutors deliver instructional interventions that are backed by rigorous research evidence and teach critical concepts and skills in reading and math, as defined by decades of research, including the National Reading Panel (2000), the National Research Council (2001), and the National Math Advisory Panel (2008).

Tutor Application and flyer can be accessed directly from our website:
 https://ctlreadingclinic.uoregon.edu/tutors.html?

Find flyer enclosed in this email if easier to print and share.
Link here: https://ctlreadingclinic.uoregon.edu/forms/tutor-flyer-fall2018.pdf?

Do not hesitate to reach me, or Anna Ingram at annad at uoregon.edu, with any questions.

Best,?



Ruby Batz, PhD.
Research Associate
Center on Teaching and Learning
College of Education, University of Oregon
     1600 Millrace Drive, Suite 245

subject: b'coe-fac: Hello from the UO Libraries'
html:
b'
Hello COE Faculty,

As we're nearing the start of a new academic year, I'd just like to quickly remind you of some of the ways that I (and the UO Libraries) can support you and your students. \xe2\x80\x8b


\xc2\xb7         Instruction sessions on research and library resources for your class. Please contact me if you\xe2\x80\x99d like me to visit your class. You can also have your class visit the library for instruction if you prefer (we have classrooms that can accommodate around 30 students).

\xc2\xb7         One-on-one or small group research consultations for you or your students. Schedule an appointment with me here (http://uoregon.libcal.com/appointment/24599) or shoot me an email to set up a time.

\xc2\xb7         I welcome your suggestions for purchases for the library collection, particularly for items like books, DVDs, etc.(items with a one-time cost). I also manage the curriculum (K-12 textbook)\xe2\x80\x8b\xe2\x80\x8b<http://researchguides.uoregon.edu/education/curriculum> and juvenile collections<http://researchguides.uoregon.edu/education/juvenile> if you have any suggestions for these areas. I can consider journal subscription requests but this is an area where budget is an issue because of inflation costs and I may not be able to fulfill your request.

\xc2\xb7         I maintain research guides<http://researchguides.uoregon.edu/prf.php?account_id=121286> for some of the programs in the COE. These should automatically appear as a tab on your Canvas course site (that you can toggle on or off as you like).

\xc2\xb7         Citation management tool help - I have experience with Zotero and Mendeley in particular but am up for tackling any of your citation management tool questions.


I\xe2\x80\x99m also happy to answer any of your library-related questions or to refer you to the library faculty or staff person who can. Let me know if you any questions, suggestions, or other ideas about how the library could support you and your students. I hope you have a good fall term!



Best,

Katherine



--
Katherine S. Donaldson
Social Sciences/Education Librarian
University of Oregon Libraries
1299 University of Oregon
Eugene, OR 97403-1299
Phone: 541-346-4132
kdonalds at uoregon.edu<mailto:kdonalds at uoregon.edu>

URL: <http://lists-prod.uoregon.edu/pipermail/coe-fac/attachments/20180919/abb70a13/attachment.html>
'

subject: b'coe-fac: Faculty vote on committee representation'
html:
b'
Dear Faculty,

As promised at Friday's Faculty and Staff meeting, please use the Qualtrics survey link here https://oregon.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_0O59myL4JuxcedD
to submit your position regarding placing a 3-year moratorium on the common practice of requiring two faculty members per department for committee representation.

Please place your vote by this Friday October 5th.

All COE faculty with .50 FTE or greater are eligible to vote.

Best,


Dianna

subject: b'coe-fac: Darleen Opfer Guest Speaker -- November 6th,\t2018 1:00 - 2:30'
html:
b'
Dear Students,

On Tuesday November 6th Dr. Darleen Opfer, Vice President for the Education and Labor Research Division at the RAND Corporation (bio attached), will be conducting a session on the topic of "Trends in Breaking Down Data Silos in Education".  In this presentation, Darleen will discuss three trends in data use that are expanding the possibilities in the conduct and use of education research:


1.       Improvements in the use of traditional education data

2.       Joining education data with other data sources

3.       'New' types of data and its potential and pitfalls for education
In discussing these three trends in data use, Darleen will provide examples from RAND research to show the ways that data can be leveraged to have greater impact on policy and practice in education.

This session will be held in HEDCO 230T from 1:00 - 2:30 on November 6th, 2018 and is open to all students in the COE. The session may be particularly relevant to students interested in leveraging education data to inform educational policy and practice.

If you are planning to attend all or part of the session, please RSVP here  https://oregon.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_dihfONiOB1YLU1L by Friday November 2nd, 2018.

Best.

Dianna Carrizales-Engelmann, Ph.D.,
Director of Administration,
College of Education

subject: b'coe-fac: COE Scholarship Information - Slide for your Lectures'
html:
b'
COE Faculty,

The COE was able to give over $700,000 to over 100 COE students this academic year. Currently, the COE is accepting applications for scholarships that will be distributed in 2019-20. It's important that all our students are aware of the funding opportunities available to them. Please consider inserting the attached PowerPoint slide regarding available scholarship funding from the COE to your lecture slides at the beginning or end of your classes from now until January 31, 2019.

The slide contains information about our upcoming information session on November 9 and January 18 at 4:00 pm in 220 HEDCO. However, I am also available to speak your class or speak to your cohort about our scholarship application process. Please contact me to schedule.

If you have any questions about who is eligible or the process for applying, don't hesitate to contact me.
Thanks!
~Andrea

________________________________
Please contact Andrea Olson with any questions regarding College of Education scholarships. Phone: 541-346-5943, email: coescholarships at uoregon.edu<mailto:coescholarships at uoregon.edu>.
________________________________
I support all students regardless of immigration status or country of origin. As a DREAMer Ally, I support Dreamer students and promote their sense of belonging and safety as thy pursue their higher education goals. For more information and resources please visit our Dreamers<https://blogs.uoregon.edu/dreamers/> page and the Find Support<https://blogs.uoregon.edu/dreamers/find-support/> page. I commit to keeping your status confidential if you reveal it to me, but also remind you that when interacting with faculty, staff, and offices around campus you are never required to reveal your immigration status.
________________________________

subject: b'coe-fac: Promotion and Tenure announcement'
html:
b'
Sent on behalf of Associate Dean Joseph Stevens

This announcement is intended for all tenure-line faculty who are planning to pursue promotion and/or tenure during next academic year (2019-20). Please consult the 2017 college policy on promotion procedures and timelines:

https://coedocs.uoregon.edu/display/governance/Promotion+and+Tenure

Note that you already should be meeting with your Department Head to plan and discuss the process and then by the end of the term with me as Associate Dean for Faculty Development. Note these timelines from the COE policy:

\xe2\x80\x9cNovember 1 Department Head prepares a list of candidates planning to submit a file for
promotion and/or tenure in the following academic year. The list, along with each candidate\xe2\x80\x99s updated CV is sent to the relevant COE Associate Dean.

November 15 Department Head confers with the Associate Dean and Dean on plans for
promotion and/or tenure of candidate(s).

December 15 Candidate meets with Associate Dean to discuss promotion and/or tenure process.\xe2\x80\x9d

Let me know if you have any questions.

Best,
Joe

~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~
   Joseph Stevens, Ph.D., Professor
   Associate Dean for Faculty Development
   Acting Dept. Head, Educational Methodology, Policy, and Leadership
   102 Education                              (541) 346-2445  (Office)
   5267 University of Oregon            stevensj at uoregon.edu<mailto:stevensj at uoregon.edu>
   Eugene, OR 97403-5267              http://www.uoregon.edu/~stevensj
~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~

subject: b"coe-fac: Children's Equity Project Partnership"
html:
b'
Dear Faculty,

As part of our ongoing activities related to the academic and practical pursuits of equity in our college, I am pleased to share that we recently agreed to partner with the Children's Equity Project (CEP), a multi-university initiative out of the Arizona State University led by Dr. Shantel Meek. CEP is working on designing and carrying out a cohesive and comprehensive national equity agenda across early childhood research, policy, and practice and has invited universities with evidence of strong research and practical successes in the area of early childhood research, policy, and practice to serve as part of their decision-making and action oriented coalition.

While the partnership is based in our college's equity work and goals, we already see potential synergies with our existing research and academic faculty and would like to make you aware of the potential for developments and opportunities for our extended faculty working in these areas.

See the document attached for additional information. Kent McIntosh and myself will be serving as primary contacts and liaisons for this work and we are excited to expand this partnership within the college. We will provide you with updates as we understand more about the scope of the CEP project, however, please feel free to contact either of us for more information or questions.

Best,
Dianna


Dianna Carrizales-Engelmann, Ph.D.,

Director of Administration
College of Education
1215 University of Oregon
(541) 346-5407

subject: b'coe-fac: UO Libraries Winter Term Reminders'
html:
b'
Hello COE faculty,

I hope you had a good holiday break. With the start of a new term, I wanted to remind you of some of the ways the UO Libraries and I can support you:


*         Library instruction - I can do lessons on using library resources for your class. I'm happy to come to your classroom, or we can have your class in the library, size permitting.

*         Consultations - You or your students can always shoot me an email if you have any library-related questions, but I also keep an appointment calendar (http://uoregon.libcal.com/appointment/24599) you can refer your students to if they'd like more in-depth research help.

*         Collections - Let me know if there's anything you'd like to see added to our library collections. I'd be happy to consider your purchase requests for books, ebooks, children's/YA books, films, etc.

*         Workshops - The UO Libraries is experimenting with offering workshops. In addition to workshops on using Canvas, we are trying out workshops related to citation management tools (Mendeley, Zotero, EndNote), data management, and digital scholarship. More information will be posted about these workshops soon, but I can tell you that citation management workshops will be offered in February. I'll share more information as it becomes available.

*         Course Reserves - You can find more information about the course reserves process here: https://library.uoregon.edu/reserves/requestreserves

I hope you'll contact me if you have any suggestions or if there's any way I can help support your classes this term.

Best,
Katherine

--
Katherine S. Donaldson
Social Sciences/Education Librarian
University of Oregon Libraries
1299 University of Oregon
Eugene, OR 97403-1299
Phone: 541-346-4132
kdonalds at uoregon.edu<mailto:kdonalds at uoregon.edu>

-------------- next part --------------
An HTML attachment was scrubbed...
URL: <http://lists-prod.uoregon.edu/pipermail/coe-fac/attachments/20190103/b1d820ea/attachment.html>
'

I commit to keeping your status confidential if you reveal it to me, but also remind you that when interacting with faculty, staff, and offices around campus you are never required to reveal your immigration status.
________________________________

subject: b'coe-fac: Core Education Course Re-approval'
html:
b'
Sent on behalf of Lillian Dur\xc3\xa1n


Hello! You are receiving this message from me to alert you about a new process for one of our courses in the COE being able to count toward core education requirements. This is just an FYI and if you need more information I would recommned attending one of the information sessions offered below. I plan to attend to help keep our college informed.



Dear Department and Program Heads

I\xe2\x80\x99m following up on my email from the end of last term. As stated then, we are planning for summer review of courses to meet the new core education requirements (see: https://provost.uoregon.edu/changes-core-education-group-and-multicultural-requirements). These new requirements are the result of several years of discussions with faculty, the University Senate and Senate committees, and represent an exciting upgrade for our students.  As the intention of these new requirements was to drive change in the curriculum, we do expect that many faculty will have to give some careful thought as to how their courses will meet the new criteria. Submission entails a completed Courseleaf form by end of Spring term which will include a description of how the course meets the new criteria.  These will be submitted directly to the UOCC and not go through the college curriculum committee. Full instructions will be sent in a separate email.

I\xe2\x80\x99ve heard back from many but not all of you. So that I can plan for summer resources, I need to know which courses you will be putting through this year, and which, if any, courses will not be submitted at all for review against the new criteria. You are strongly encouraged to put through some, if not all, of your courses this year so that we can even the workload over the next 3 years.

I\xe2\x80\x99d appreciate a response with those details by January 18, 5:00pm.

We are offering two workshops in January to help faculty learn about the new requirements and how to best tailor their courses to meet those requirements (see https://tep.uoregon.edu/workshops-and-events).  Please forward this to your faculty and encourage them to attend.

January 24, 2019:            Thursday, January 24      1:30-3:00pm      Gerlinger Alumni Lounge
January 25, 2019:            Friday, January 25            10-11:30am        Gerlinger Alumni Lounge

Thanks in advance for your help with this and please contact me directly if I can answer any questions.

Best
Ron


For scheduling, please contact Carolyn Vogt at acaffrecep at uoregon.edu<mailto:acaffrecep at uoregon.edu> or 541-346-3081.
[/Users/Ron/Library/Containers/com.microsoft.Outlook/Data/Library/Caches/Signatures/signature_1471165596]

Ron Bramhall | Associate Vice Provost for Academic Excellence

1F Johnson Hall
1258 University of Oregon | Eugene, OR 97403

subject: b"coe-fac: Children's Equity Project Partnership"
html:
b'
Dear Faculty,

The work of the Children's Equity Project (CEP) has gained some renewed momentum following the break and, as promised, we wanted to provide you with a brief update as we begin to engage in the partnership in earnest. As Kent and I consider the possible points of intersection for this work with our college, it was helpful for us to learn that the CEP defines equity in terms of the following 5 lenses for the purpose of managing the potentially broad scope the work:


  *   Discipline (especially exclusionary practices in discipline and mental health)
  *   Language (especially dual language)
  *   Inclusion (of students with disabilities)
  *   Tribal needs and causes
  *   Maternal and child health track (CEP has a significant focus on birth to early elementary school aged children.)


Also, we confirmed that the objective of the partnership is to harness the skillset and capacity of experts in national institutions and across like projects towards impacting two predominant areas:

  *   Data and research and
  *   Policy


While they have multiple projects underway, the CEP recently invited the UO to participate in two upcoming projects.

  *   A response to the White House's recent School Safety Report
  *   The development of a report on the State of Equity in the nation (in the 5 areas)

We plan to reach out to those who have already expressed interest in the coming days (thank you!). However, we will continue to provide occasional and more targeted updates as the work takes shape and takes on a predictable format. We may also take the liberty of reaching out with tentative invitations to specific faculty if we think there may be points of synergy that make sense with your work as we understand it. Again, please feel free to reach out to Kent or I with questions.

Best,
Dianna


From: coe-fac-bounces at lists.uoregon.edu<mailto:coe-fac-bounces at lists.uoregon.edu> [mailto:coe-fac-bounces at lists.uoregon.edu] On Behalf Of Dianna Carrizales-Engelmann
Sent: Wednesday, December 05, 2018 8:46 AM
To: coe-fac at lists.uoregon.edu<mailto:coe-fac at lists.uoregon.edu>
Subject: coe-fac: Children's Equity Project Partnership

Dear Faculty,

As part of our ongoing activities related to the academic and practical pursuits of equity in our college, I am pleased to share that we recently agreed to partner with the Children's Equity Project (CEP), a multi-university initiative out of the Arizona State University led by Dr. Shantel Meek. CEP is working on designing and carrying out a cohesive and comprehensive national equity agenda across early childhood research, policy, and practice and has invited universities with evidence of strong research and practical successes in the area of early childhood research, policy, and practice to serve as part of their decision-making and action oriented coalition.

While the partnership is based in our college's equity work and goals, we already see potential synergies with our existing research and academic faculty and would like to make you aware of the potential for developments and opportunities for our extended faculty working in these areas.

See the document attached for additional information. Kent McIntosh and myself will be serving as primary contacts and liaisons for this work and we are excited to expand this partnership within the college. We will provide you with updates as we understand more about the scope of the CEP project, however, please feel free to contact either of us for more information or questions.

Best,
Dianna


Dianna Carrizales-Engelmann, Ph.D.,

Director of Administration
College of Education
1215 University of Oregon
(541) 346-5407

-------------- next part --------------
An HTML attachment was scrubbed...
URL: <http://lists-prod.uoregon.edu/pipermail/coe-fac/attachments/20190124/36e505dd/attachment-0001.html>
'

subject: b'coe-fac: NTTF Work Planning Sessions Winter/Spring 2019'
html:
b'
This message is intended for Non Tenure Track Faculty (NTTF) as defined in the 2017 COE NTTF Professional Responsibilities Policy:

Dear NTTF Faculty,

This year marks the first full year's implementation of the NTTF professional responsibilities policy. As you may recall from your review of the policy (attached), a "workload planning session" is now scheduled to occur annually. This is the moment when your teaching schedule is discussed with your supervisor or Department Head, and your courses are scheduled for the upcoming year. COE NTTF Professional Responsibilities Policy Section III (B) (page 5):

Annual review (the Workload Planning Session)
This position description should be reviewed annually as part of a workload planning session. With regard to these planning sessions, this policy acknowledges that the Provost or designee (e.g., Department Head or Dean) shall be responsible for the scheduling and assignment of all faculty members' professional responsibilities. A faculty member shall be afforded the opportunity to meet with their Department Head at least annually before workload responsibilities are assigned in order to discuss programmatic needs and each faculty member's preferences regarding assignments for teaching, research or scholarship (as appropriate), service, and other professional responsibilities (refer to CBA, Article 17, Section 6 as of the date of this policy). These workload planning sessions should also take into account variances between planned/negotiated FTE and the actual work performed during previous years within each of the four workload areas (teaching, service, research, and administration). The intent of this aspect of the policy is to provide Department Heads with the ability to accommodate variances by recognizing unplanned demands placed on faculty. As always, academic program needs are intended to guide decision-making in this area.

Department Heads will be engaging in workload planning sessions with you/your supervisors in conjunction with your performance evaluation discussions and the attached document will be completed at the time of your discussion to assist in tracking decisions and any changes made annually.

Additional information about the performance evaluation timeline will be forthcoming.

Best,
Dianna
6-5407

subject: b'coe-fac: COE Recruitment Scholarship Nominations - NOW AVAILABLE'
html:
b'
Sent on Behalf of Dean Randy Kamphaus
________________________________
I am pleased to announce the availability of 18 master\xe2\x80\x99s degree student recruitment scholarships. Most of these scholarships will include an award of $8,000 for a maximum of one academic year. New this year are two recruitment scholarships (Prevention Science and School Psychology) that will cover tuition and fees for two to three years. These scholarships are awarded by our academic program area faculty at the time of admission to help recruit the most highly qualified students to our master\xe2\x80\x99s programs. Please note, applicants who have already accepted an admission offer from the UO do not qualify for recruitment funding.

Recruitment scholarships were made available to master\xe2\x80\x99s degree programs based on:

\xc2\xb7         donor gift agreement stipulations (e.g., some scholarships specific academic programs and financial need),

\xc2\xb7         current academic program enrollments and applicant pools (e.g., large programs with the potential to grow further),

\xc2\xb7         and licensure area personnel shortages (e.g., secondary teachers, special educators, speech pathologists, etc.).
See award allocations below.

In order to make student recruitment more efficient and effective, our Development group has created a procedure for making these awards that involves completion of a simple form.  The only requirement is that nominees be approved by the Office of Development before any offers to candidates can be made.  If you have any questions whatsoever, please contact Andrea Olson (andreao at uoregon.edu<mailto:andreao at uoregon.edu>).  PLEASE DESIGNATE THE APPROPRIATE PROGRAM DIRECTOR TO FILL OUT THIS FORM: https://oregon.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_0HAxvNfqLGIesap

Wishing us a great recruiting year,

Randy

________________________________

RECRUITMENT FUNDS AVAILABLE FOR COE MASTER'S PROGRAMS<https://oregon.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_0HAxvNfqLGIesap>

Fill out this form<https://oregon.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_0HAxvNfqLGIesap> for each nominee and alternative nominee by March 1, 2019.

It is not the program or department's responsibility to ascertain a nominee's financial need or Oregon state residency. The COE Office of Development will determine financial need and residency of nominees and will inform you if your recruit does NOT meet the requirement.


Please provide an alternative nominee for each recruitment scholarship available. Nominees must be cleared with the Office of Development before any offers to candidates can be made or mentioned.



COUNSELING PSYCHOLOGY & HUMAN SERVICES
Prevention Science - MEd/MS (2)

  *   One Not Restricted - $8,000
  *   One Renewable (MS only) - $25,000

EDUCATIONAL METHODOLOGY POLICY & LEADERSHIP

Educational Leadership \xe2\x80\x93 MS (1)

  *   One Not Restricted - $8,000

EDUCATION STUDIES

Curriculum and Teaching: UOTeach Early Ed/Elementary (2)

  *   Two Financial Need Based* - $8,000 each

Curriculum and Teaching: UOTeach Mid/High Education (3)

  *   One for Oregon Resident** - $8,000
  *   One for STEM Student - $8,000
  *   One Not Restricted - $8,000

Sapsik\xe2\x80\x98\xca\xb7a\xc5\x82\xc3\xa1 Project \xe2\x80\x93 MEd (1)

  *   One for Either Financial Need* OR Resident (or both)** - $8,000

SPECIAL EDUCATION AND CLINICAL SERVICES

Communication Disorders and Sciences - MA/MS/post-bac (2)

  *   Two Not Restricted - $8,000
  *   One Not Restricted - $6,000

School Psychology - MS (2)

  *    One for Early Literacy AND Financial Need* - $8,000
  *   One Renewable Not Restricted - $38,000

Special Education - MA/MS/MEd (2)

  *   One for Early Literacy - $8,000
  *   One Not Restricted - $8,000

text:
b"Sent on Behalf of Dean Randy Kamphaus
________________________________
I am pleased to announce the availability of 18 master\xe2\x80\x99s degree student recruitment scholarships. Most of these scholarships will include an award of $8,000 for a maximum of one academic year. New this year are two recruitment scholarships (Prevention Science and School Psychology) that will cover tuition and fees for two to three years. These scholarships are awarded by our academic program area faculty at the time of admission to help recruit the most highly qualified students to our master\xe2\x80\x99s programs. Please note, applicants who have already accepted an admission offer from the UO do not qualify for recruitment funding.

Recruitment scholarships were made available to master\xe2\x80\x99s degree programs based on:

\xc2\xb7         donor gift agreement stipulations (e.g., some scholarships specific academic programs and financial need),

\xc2\xb7         current academic program enrollments and applicant pools (e.g., large programs with the potential to grow further),

\xc2\xb7         and licensure area personnel shortages (e.g., secondary teachers, special educators, speech pathologists, etc.).
See award allocations below.

In order to make student recruitment more efficient and effective, our Development group has created a procedure for making these awards that involves completion of a simple form.  The only requirement is that nominees be approved by the Office of Development before any offers to candidates can be made.  If you have any questions whatsoever, please contact Andrea Olson (andreao at uoregon.edu<mailto:andreao at uoregon.edu>).  PLEASE DESIGNATE THE APPROPRIATE PROGRAM DIRECTOR TO FILL OUT THIS FORM: https://oregon.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_0HAxvNfqLGIesap

Wishing us a great recruiting year,

Randy

________________________________

RECRUITMENT FUNDS AVAILABLE FOR COE MASTER'S PROGRAMS<https://oregon.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_0HAxvNfqLGIesap>

Fill out this form<https://oregon.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_0HAxvNfqLGIesap> for each nominee and alternative nominee by March 1, 2019.

It is not the program or department's responsibility to ascertain a nominee's financial need or Oregon state residency. The COE Office of Development will determine financial need and residency of nominees and will inform you if your recruit does NOT meet the requirement.


Please provide an alternative nominee for each recruitment scholarship available. Nominees must be cleared with the Office of Development before any offers to candidates can be made or mentioned.



COUNSELING PSYCHOLOGY & HUMAN SERVICES
Prevention Science - MEd/MS (2)

  *   One Not Restricted - $8,000
  *   One Renewable (MS only) - $25,000

EDUCATIONAL METHODOLOGY POLICY & LEADERSHIP

Educational Leadership \xe2\x80\x93 MS (1)

  *   One Not Restricted - $8,000

EDUCATION STUDIES

Curriculum and Teaching: UOTeach Early Ed/Elementary (2)

  *   Two Financial Need Based* - $8,000 each

Curriculum and Teaching: UOTeach Mid/High Education (3)

  *   One for Oregon Resident** - $8,000
  *   One for STEM Student - $8,000
  *   One Not Restricted - $8,000

Sapsik\xe2\x80\x98\xca\xb7a\xc5\x82\xc3\xa1 Project \xe2\x80\x93 MEd (1)

  *   One for Either Financial Need* OR Resident (or both)** - $8,000

SPECIAL EDUCATION AND CLINICAL SERVICES

Communication Disorders and Sciences - MA/MS/post-bac (2)

  *   Two Not Restricted - $8,000
  *   One Not Restricted - $6,000

School Psychology - MS (2)

  *    One for Early Literacy AND Financial Need* - $8,000
  *   One Renewable Not Restricted - $38,000

Special Education - MA/MS/MEd (2)

  *   One for Early Literacy - $8,000
  *   One Not Restricted - $8,000

*Financial need is ascertained by the University of Oregon and based on the applicant filing a FAFSA, ORSAA, or International Student Financial Resources by March 1.

**Oregon residency is based on UO Admissions. Residency rules can be found here https://admissions.uoregon.edu/freshmen/residency/rules.

subject: b'coe-fac: COE Faculty Fund Call For Proposals - Due by March 15'
html:
b'
Faculty Fund Award Application
Proposal for Project Grant
The College of Education's Faculty Fund Awards provides financial support for the innovative ideas that contribute to the early career development of our faculty members. Funding is meant to catalyze projects and help faculty members achieve sustainability.
Eligibility: All College of Education faculty (FTE of .5 or greater) are eligible to apply for awards, both NTTF and TTF.
Applications will be based on meritorious factors that include:

  *   Projects that are not yet funded or have no other funding sources available
  *   Projects in a current area of priority or importance for the college
  *   High visibility projects
  *   Applicants that have not received a faculty fund award in the past three years
Application Steps:

  1.  Complete and submit the proposal for funds application<https://coe.uoregon.edu/facultyfundawards/faculty-fund-awards/> by March 15, 2019.
  2.  Associate Dean of Research for the College of Education will notify applicants being considered by March 22, 2019.
  3.  Preliminary proposal applicants chosen will submit fuller proposals that:
     *   Develop the design and implementation plans
     *   Propose a plan to evaluate the initiative
     *   Propose a detailed budget. Please get input from your business manager as you develop a budget to ensure that all proposed costs are reasonable and allowable.
  4.  Final applications will be due April 5, 2019. Applications will be reviewed and award decisions made by the deans of the College of Education. The COE Office of Development will review applications for alignment with the fund's intention.
  5.  Project funding will be announced by April 12, 2019.
  6.  Lead faculty in any funded project will give an annual written update to the donor. The awardees will also provide the COE Office of Development with necessary narrative and fiscal information to submit an annual report to the donor on the use and impact of funds.
Preliminary Proposal deadline: March 15, 2019
Complete and submit the proposal for funds application<proposal%20for%20funds%20application> here: https://coe.uoregon.edu/facultyfundawards/faculty-fund-awards/
If you have any questions whatsoever, please contact Andrea Olson (andreao at uoregon.edu<mailto:andreao at uoregon.edu>).
________________________________

subject: b'coe-fac: Faculty Professional Development Funds Available - Applications Due February 22'
html:
b'
Sent on behalf of Randy Kamphaus

________________________________
Dear Faculty,

I continue to be impressed with the professional development activities in which you engage to advance the quality and reach of your scholarship and teaching. I want to further support these activities. I am providing Faculty Professional Development funds for which all College faculty may apply. A total of $2,500 may be requested each academic year. Current applications will be accepted until February 22  Applications for expenses that have been incurred within the last 6 months may be reimbursed. Funding priority is given to professional development activities that advance your research productivity and/or teaching quality.

To apply, please click on the link below. Please direct any questions about the application to Andrea Olson, andreao at uoregon.edu<mailto:andreao at uoregon.edu>.

https://coe.uoregon.edu/facultyfundawards/request-for-professional-development-funds/


Thank you,
Randy
For scheduling, please contact Maggie Bosworth at  magboz at uoregon.edu<mailto:%20magboz at uoregon.edu> or 541-346-6467.
________________________________
________________________________

subject: b'coe-fac: COE Local Metrics Submission update'
html:
b'
Dear Faculty,

The Provost's office has provided feedback on the COE local metrics that were submitted to OtP last Spring. The OtP reviewed our submission and offered COE leadership (Dean and Department Heads) an opportunity to respond to feedback and provide additional updates to the metrics in early Fall.

Those updates are now reflected in the attached document "Special Education and Clinical Sciences Data Definitions" (Please note: In spite of the file name, the content of these document are the same for each department). The OtP is now requesting department-specific faculty input on the updated local metrics.

To facilitate faculty review, please use the updated Qualtrics survey here: https://oregon.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_4G7Q7R6xmyDMrrv

Please provide any additional input by Wednesday, February 13th 2019.

Please contact your Department Head with any additional questions.


Best,
Dianna


From: coe-fac-bounces at lists.uoregon.edu<mailto:coe-fac-bounces at lists.uoregon.edu> [mailto:coe-fac-bounces at lists.uoregon.edu] On Behalf Of Dianna Carrizales-Engelmann
Sent: Wednesday, May 30, 2018 11:56 AM
To: coe-fac at lists.uoregon.edu<mailto:coe-fac at lists.uoregon.edu>
Subject: coe-fac: COE Local Metrics Submission

Dear Faculty,

The updated local metrics file that is being submitted to the Provost's office is attached. Thank you for your input in various meetings and via survey.

Thanks to that input, and to advice based on robust discussions with the FAC and Department Heads, we have spelled out acronyms, clarified some of the wording, and included the following newly suggested metrics from the faculty survey:

1)      Refereed technical papers(under publications)

2)      State contracts and grants (under grants)

3)      Manuscript reviews (under other)

We will keep you apprised of any updates or feedback we receive from the Provost's office on our submission.

Dianna

text:
b'Dear Faculty,

The Provost's office has provided feedback on the COE local metrics that were submitted to OtP last Spring. The OtP reviewed our submission and offered COE leadership (Dean and Department Heads) an opportunity to respond to feedback and provide additional updates to the metrics in early Fall.

Those updates are now reflected in the attached document "Special Education and Clinical Sciences Data Definitions" (Please note: In spite of the file name, the content of these document are the same for each department). The OtP is now requesting department-specific faculty input on the updated local metrics.

To facilitate faculty review, please use the updated Qualtrics survey here: https://oregon.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_4G7Q7R6xmyDMrrv

Please provide any additional input by Wednesday, February 13th 2019.

Please contact your Department Head with any additional questions.


Best,
Dianna


From: coe-fac-bounces at lists.uoregon.edu<mailto:coe-fac-bounces at lists.uoregon.edu> [mailto:coe-fac-bounces at lists.uoregon.edu] On Behalf Of Dianna Carrizales-Engelmann
Sent: Wednesday, May 30, 2018 11:56 AM
To: coe-fac at lists.uoregon.edu<mailto:coe-fac at lists.uoregon.edu>
Subject: coe-fac: COE Local Metrics Submission

Dear Faculty,

The updated local metrics file that is being submitted to the Provost's office is attached. Thank you for your input in various meetings and via survey.

Thanks to that input, and to advice based on robust discussions with the FAC and Department Heads, we have spelled out acronyms, clarified some of the wording, and included the following newly suggested metrics from the faculty survey:

1)      Refereed technical papers(under publications)

2)      State contracts and grants (under grants)

3)      Manuscript reviews (under other)

We will keep you apprised of any updates or feedback we receive from the Provost's office on our submission.

Dianna

Dianna Carrizales-Engelmann, Ph.D.,

Director of Administration and
Teacher of Clinical Practice and Performance Assessment
College of Education
1215 University of Oregon
(541) 346-5407

subject: b'coe-fac: Faculty Annual Evaluations -- Submission of evaluation materials by March 8th'
html:
b'
Dear Faculty,

The faculty annual review process begins this month, February, with an expected completion date of April 8th. The guidelines and procedures below describe expectations for completing these annual faculty reviews.

All Faculty (Instructional NTTF, Research NTTF, and TTF):

  *   The period under review for all faculty is January 1, 2018 - December 31, 2018.  The review will encompass all professional activity within the calendar year (which includes publications, instruction, service, research and contributions to equity and inclusion as relevant to the faculty position).
     *   From the COE Annual Review and Merit Department Guideline, "Annual Review documents are prepared by faculty in the winter term of each year, following the COE templates for Annual Reviews. Annual Review meetings between the faculty member and immediate supervisor (Department Head or Program Director in academic units; Unit Director or direct supervisor in research units) are conducted in spring term."
  *   No later than March 8th, 2019: By this date, all faculty will submit required forms to their supervisor as described below.
  *   March 9th - April 8th, 2019: During this time frame, supervisors will schedule 1-1 annual review meetings with faculty. The purpose of these meetings will be to discuss performance in the past calendar year and discuss performance goals for the upcoming year.
  *   April 15th, 2019: By this date, supervisors must complete all evaluations and submit all evaluation materials to COE HR.
     *   For instructional NTTF and TTF, the evaluation materials expected for submission include the Executive Summary, CV, and FARE* [Faculty Annual Review and Evaluation] feedback form for each faculty member.
     *   For research NTTF, the evaluation materials expected for submission include the Annual Evaluation Form and CV.
     *   *Faculty Annual Review Templates and Forms<https://coedocs.uoregon.edu/display/governance/Annual+Review+and+Merit+Review+Policies> are available on the COE Governance site. Faculty and their supervisor must use the most current versions of the templates stored on the COE Governance site, since there have been changes to these documents from prior years.

Instructional NTTF Only:

  *   No later than March 8th, 2019, instructional NTTF must submit a completed Instructional NTTF Annual Review Executive Summary* and a highlighted CV to their Department Head and Program Director. The Executive Summary document outlines performance accomplishments, achievements, and growth over the performance period of January 1, 2018 - December 31, 2018. The Executive Summary should be no longer than two pages in length. The CV should highlight (via color coding/shading) calendar year 2018 accomplishments. There are no restrictions on page lengths for CVs.

Research NTTF Only:

  *   No later than March 8th, 2019, research NTTF must submit to their supervisor a Research NTTF Annual Evaluation form* with sections 1 - 5 completed and a highlighted CV. Note that there are three versions of the Research NTTF Annual Evaluation form, one for each research classification series (Research Assistant, Research Associate, Research Professor). The CV should highlight (via color coding/shading) calendar year 2018 accomplishments. There are no restrictions on page lengths for CVs.

TTF Only:

  *   No later than March 8th, 2019, TTF must submit a completed TTF Annual Review Executive Summary* and a highlighted CV to their Department Head. The Executive Summary document outlines performance accomplishments, achievements, and growth over the performance period of January 1, 2018 - December 31, 2018. The Executive Summary should be no longer than four pages in length. The CV should highlight (via color coding/shading) calendar year 2018 accomplishments. There are no restrictions on page lengths for CVs.

Thank you,
Amy

Amy Green
College of Education
Assistant Director of Human Resources, COE
HEDCO 230
Eugene,  OR 97403
Phone:  541-346-2449  Email:  amygreen at uroegon.edu<mailto:amygreen at uroegon.edu>

[COE-3435-CGY11-2]

subject: b'coe-fac: Citation Management Tool Workshops at UO Libraries'
text:
b'Hello COE faculty,

A reminder should have gone out on the graduate school listserv, but I wanted to remind you that if you or your students are interested in learning more about getting started with citation management tools, the UO Libraries will be offering introductory workshops on Mendeley, Zotero, and EndNote starting this week. All workshops will be from 2:00 pm to 3:00 pm on the following dates:

Feb. 20 - Intro to Mendeley<https://oregon.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_4SWVYzwrqcVTcpL>
Feb. 21 - Intro to Mendeley<https://oregon.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_7R788I6D2A0Zr7f>
Feb. 27 - Intro to Zotero<https://oregon.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_8k6T79PEcVGqDyZ>
Feb. 28 - Intro to Zotero<https://oregon.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_0P2TNelvv7karoV>
Mar. 6 - Intro to EndNote<https://oregon.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_bPoYC5awqsfQK7b>
Mar. 7 - Intro to Endnote <https://oregon.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_bIArZ4pDptmJcuV>

To register, click on the link for the session you are interested in above. All workshops and other library events can also be found on the UO Libraries events calendar: https://library.uoregon.edu/calendar


Best,
Katherine

--
Katherine S. Donaldson
Social Sciences/Education Librarian
University of Oregon Libraries
1299 University of Oregon
Eugene, OR 97403-1299
Phone: 541-346-4132
kdonalds at uoregon.edu<mailto:kdonalds at uoregon.edu>

subject: b'coe-fac: New Education Resource at UO Libraries'
html:
b'
Hello COE faculty,

I wanted to bring to your attention a new library resource that may be relevant to you that the UO Libraries has subscribed to on a trial basis.

Cabells Scholarly Analytics<http://researchguides.uoregon.edu/cabells> provides information on academic journals that researchers may want to know when they are evaluating which academic journals to publish in, such as acceptance rates, impact factor, etc. A couple of you expressed interest in this resource, and I hope you will give it a try and let me know if it seems like something that would be useful to you.

The UO Libraries has subscribed to the Education set of the journal whitelist for a one year period and will evaluate whether we should continue our subscription (and consider other disciplinary sets) after this period. Our subscription does not include access to the journal blacklist. If you'd like to browse the journals included in the whitelist, you can click on "whitelist" in the upper menu bar and then browse by a number of filters including discipline area, impact factor, peer review and open access policies and more (see screenshot).

You can find this resource by following this link: http://researchguides.uoregon.edu/cabells. It is also linked in our database A-Z list and in LibrarySearch.

Please let me know if you have any questions or feedback about this resource!

Best,
Katherine

--
Katherine S. Donaldson
Social Sciences/Education Librarian
University of Oregon Libraries
1299 University of Oregon
Eugene, OR 97403-1299
Phone: 541-346-4132
kdonalds at uoregon.edu<mailto:kdonalds at uoregon.edu>

subject: b'coe-fac: FW: 2018-2019 Workload policy update'
html:
b'
Dear Faculty,
As "workload planning session" activities will be beginning in departments in the coming weeks (see NTTF Work Planning Sessions Winter/Spring 2019 email dated February 1st), I am resending this September email that provides some additional context.
Best,
Dianna
From: coe-staff-bounces at lists.uoregon.edu<mailto:coe-staff-bounces at lists.uoregon.edu> [mailto:coe-staff-bounces at lists.uoregon.edu] On Behalf Of Dianna Carrizales-Engelmann
Sent: Friday, September 14, 2018 10:09 AM
To: coe-staff at lists.uoregon.edu<mailto:coe-staff at lists.uoregon.edu>
Subject: coe-staff: 2018-2019 Workload policy update

Dear Faculty,
Welcome back! I know this is only one of many welcome back messages you will be receiving in the next few days, so I thought it might be good to share one that is primarily informative.
As of December 5th, 2017, both of the COE's faculty workload policies were finalized following their respective CBA policy development phases https://coedocs.uoregon.edu/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=8912911 . This means that we are starting the 2018 - 2019 academic year with both of our CBA workload policies intact. While it is important to acknowledge that these policies have been (and will likely continue to be) debated in the appropriate forums throughout the college, these policies are now in place. The full implementation of these policies and any related changes to our practices, will begin this 2018-2019 academic year along with the collection of data that will inform any future changes that are deemed necessary (based on the policies' implementation). As noted in previous communications, both the NTTF and TTF policies have anticipated the formation of review committees (Task Forces) who will review their implementation to address any concerns that may arise.
As we continue to implement these new policies, Department Heads will be engaged in the careful facilitation of certain processes:

*       Development of individual Work Assignment documents: Department Heads will complete these with their faculty annually to document workload per faculty member (instructional and non-instructional) and note any caveats, changes, or specific arrangements.

*       Collection of annual workload data by department: Department Heads will complete these with their Business Managers to document workload per department and note any caveats, changes, or specific arrangements.

*       Review of any NTTF position descriptions in order to identify and develop consistent language for non-instructional (administrative) duties across programs and departments.

*       Development of task-specific job descriptions for administrative (i.e. non-instructional) roles, such as Program Coordinator and Program Director.


These activities will generate the most change in those NTTF position descriptions that list administrative (non-instructional) responsibilities. Many of these discussions began in departments last year. Any changes that come about as a result of the bullets above will be made in consultation with Department Heads and Program Leadership and with input from impacted (potentially impacted) faculty as appropriate.
Because the work that faculty engages in is multi-dimensional, we know that some of the content of the policies will not fit all of the unique circumstances that we might encounter, for that reason, the Implementation Guidance document (attached) was created and distributed to provide Department Heads with support as they navigate unique and nuanced circumstances of our faculty's day to day reality.
Feel free to follow up with me if you have any questions.

Best,

Dianna

Dianna Carrizales-Engelmann, Ph.D.,
Director of Administration,
College of Education
(541) 346-5407

subject: b'coe-fac: SAVE THE DATE: Cocktails with Oregon COE in Toronto Sunday,\tApril 7'
html:
b'
View this email in your browser<https://mailchi.mp/3d45b64ce73a/save-the-date-cocktails-with-oregon-coe-in-toronto-sunday-april-7?e=ddd80e7107>







[https://gallery.mailchimp.com/1f6ab32a744b7c1084c7e4bd6/images/2d6c370d-f100-4afa-94cc-69e31614c503.jpg]






Save the Date for the UO College of Education cocktail reception in Toronto, Canada on April 7, 2019.

Each year, the College of Education gathers during the annual American Education Research Association (AERA) conference to to celebrate the spirit of discovery and highlight new and exciting research.

When: Sunday, April 7, 2019
            7:00 - 9:30 PM

Where: R&D Restaurant
             241 Spadina Ave
             Toronto, ON M5T 2E2







Join us for cocktails and conversation as we celebrate our faculty\xe2\x80\x99s groundbreaking research at the event of the season.

If you have any questions, please contact
Lisa Fortin<mailto:coeevents at uoregon.edu?subject=Questions%20Regarding%20UO%20AERA%20Reception>, Director of Events.

Invitations with finalized details will be sent in March.







We look forward to seeing you in Toronto!




 #coeDucks #AERA2019

subject: b'coe-fac: AERA brochure listing'
html:
b'
Hello,
As AERA is just around the corner, we are pulling together the information for our AERA brochure.  This brochure is a listing of all the presentations, poster sessions and etc., that have the participation of someone from the College of Education.  Attached is a very rough draft of the brochure text.  If you are on the list below, please review the attached document to ensure your sessions are listed correctly.  The data doesn\xe2\x80\x99t transfer very neatly from the online listings, so please double check to see that if you are presenting, you are on the list and if not, just let me know and I\xe2\x80\x99ll go and pull your presentations.

I have 4 people who are listed as UO, but do not come up in \xe2\x80\x98find people\xe2\x80\x99 so I don\xe2\x80\x99t know who they are.  If you know Cameron Fischer, Robin Wright, Mengfan Zhai, and Zige Zhao can you let me have their program name and email addresses?

Please provide me your comments and corrections no later than 5 pm on Monday, March 11.
Thanks,
Lisa

subject: b'coe-fac: Reorder your rental regalia online in one easy click'
html:
b'
Hello,
The Duck Store has changed its process this year for ordering regalia for commencement.  You can put \xe2\x80\x9cBill COE\xe2\x80\x9d into the space where the index should go.  If you have any problems, please contact me.  I apologize for any confusion.
Lisa

Lisa Fortin
Director, Events and Student Recruitment
College of Education
541-346-1607

From: Duck Store Graduation <graduation at uoduckstore.com>
Sent: Thursday, March 7, 2019 10:17 AM
To: Lisa Fortin <lfortin at uoregon.edu>
Cc: Duck Store Graduation <graduation at uoduckstore.com>
Subject: RE: Reorder your rental regalia online in one easy click

Lisa,

In years past, faculty members have been able to select \xe2\x80\x98Bill Department\xe2\x80\x99 without needing to input an Index Number. We\xe2\x80\x99ve hit a few snags with billing the past couple of years because we did not have Index Numbers at the time of invoicing departments. After talking with our Controller, this change was made for the 2019 commencement season in order to avoid these challenges. That said, we are certainly able to accommodate your request to not require an Index Number for all COE regalia orders. Please have your faculty simply enter \xe2\x80\x98Bill COE\xe2\x80\x99 in the Index Number field and we\xe2\x80\x99ll make a note for our operations team that we can bill without an Index Number.

This is the second year we\xe2\x80\x99ve sent an email blast out to faculty members requesting their regalia orders and we certainly did not intend to create any confusion, so our apologies if you received unexpected questions from your faculty. Our primary goal with these emails is to reach out to any & all faculty who placed a regalia order in the past and make the reorder process as smooth as possible. Since we didn\xe2\x80\x99t receive any negative feedback or inquiries last year, we proceeded with the email blast as scheduled.

As our deadline for faculty regalia orders is May 1, our intention was to send out an initial email blast in March and then follow up with any faculty members who have yet to place their 2019 regalia reorder beginning of April. We plan to send a final email reminder to faculty just before the May 1 deadline.

Is there anything else we can provide that would be of help to you & your staff for the 2019 commencement season? We appreciate the opportunity to work with you & your faculty to ensure a smooth and successful graduation season!

Dalton J Lee
Campus Outreach Coordinator

-------------- next part --------------

URL: <http://lists-prod.uoregon.edu/pipermail/coe-fac/attachments/20190307/39c3cc1e/attachment.html>

subject: b'coe-fac: Change in support for promotion and/or tenure'
html:
b'
Hello All,

I want to make you all aware of a change in duties and responsibilities in the Dean\xe2\x80\x99s office.

Effective immediately, Maggie Bosworth, Executive Assistant to the Dean, will be the primary support for the College of Education\xe2\x80\x99s faculty Promotion and Tenure Review (for TTF and CNNTF) as well as mid-term and post-tenure reviews.  Maggie has been coordinating the college level faculty personnel committee review process as well as the dean\xe2\x80\x99s review.  Beginning this spring Maggie will expand her role to provide administrative support for the entire review process.

We offer our sincere appreciation to Amy Green for all her efforts in coordinating the process in the past. Amy has been supporting our promotion and tenure candidates and the review process since she joined the College of Education in 2012.  As our needs and activities in human resources increase, Amy will now be able to focus her time entirely on personnel related responsibilities for our college.

Best,
Joe

~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~
   Joseph Stevens, Ph.D., Professor
   Associate Dean for Faculty Development
   102 Education                              (541) 346-2445  (Office)
   5267 University of Oregon            stevensj at uoregon.edu<mailto:stevensj at uoregon.edu>
   Eugene, OR 97403-5267              http://www.uoregon.edu/~stevensj
~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~

subject: b'coe-fac: COE Reception at AERA'
html:
b'
Hello,
If you are attending AERA, please don't forget to RSVP for the COE reception.  It will be held Sunday, April 7th from 7 - 9:30 pm at the R&D Restaurant, 241 Spadina Ave<https://www.rdspadina.com/>.   It's not only a chance to mingle with your COE colleagues, but also an opportunity to invite folks from other academic institutions.  Click here to RSVP!<https://oregon.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_bIehKhxEXWEqeyx>

Thanks,
Lisa

subject: b'coe-fac: Election for CoE University Senate Vacancy'
html:
b'
SENT ON BEHALF OF ANGELA WILHELMS (Statutory Faculty Coordinator) and the UNIVERISTY SENATE

Dear COE Faculty:

As you may know, Professor Elizabeth Skowron's position has recently transferred to CAS. This transfer means she is no longer eligible to serve in her position as a COE-elected faculty senator. This creates a vacancy in the University Senate for a statutory faculty member. The vacancy is for the remainder of this academic year and for academic year 2019-2020. We will conduct a mini-election the first week of term to fill this vacancy. Please email Angela Wilhelms (wilhelms at uoregon.edu<mailto:wilhelms at uoregon.edu>) with a cc to Dianna Carrizales-Engelmann by Wednesday, March 27 if you are interested in running to fill this vacancy, or have a colleague to nominate.  There is no restriction on which department a senator may come from, but because two remaining senators are both from SPECS, we do support the idea of diversifying your representation. Again, this is not a preclusion on anyone who wants to run...maybe just a little prod to other departments...

It is worth noting that regular annual university senate and committee elections are coming up in late April. Two COE positions will be up for election this year for full two-year terms. Sitting senators may seek re-election, but others are of course welcome to run. This special election will be just for this vacancy and partial term.

Thank you,
Angela
(Statutory Faculty Coordinator Role)

subject: b'coe-fac: Faculty and Staff Awards Committee'
html:
b'
Hello,
We are assembling our committee for the faculty and staff awards and we would like to add a tenure track faculty member.  Service on the committee is light.  Once we've gathered our award nominations, I'll send them to the committee to review.  Then the committee will get together for a 2-hour meeting to select our recipients and that's it!  If a committee member is unable to make the meeting, all they do is provide me their comments and selections and I'll present them to the rest of the committee.   My timeline is to have the meeting in May sometime as we will present the awards at our Staff and Faculty picnic in early June.

Please let me know if you are interested in nominating yourself or someone else to serve on this committee.

Thank you!

Lisa Fortin
Director, Events and Student Recruitment
College of Education
541-346-1607

subject: b'coe-fac: COE faculty regalia list for Commencement'
html:
b'
Hello,
The list of faculty below have ordered regalia from the Duck Store for Commencement as of April 18.  Please order rental regalia prior to May 1st as the Duck Store can't guarantee hood colors after that date and may charge a late fee.

Important Dates & Deadlines:
*             May 1, 2019: Order deadline for custom-made fine regalia and guaranteed hood colors. After that date, The Duck Store will provide either University of Oregon colors or the closest match possible. The Duck Store can research regalia options for most universities.
*             May 1, 2019: The Duck Store reserves the right to charge a $15.00 late fee for orders placed on or after May 1st.
*             June 10-12, 2019: Faculty regalia will be delivered to departments.  You will be notified when you can come to HEDCO 130 to pick it up.

Tiffany  Brown

subject: b"coe-fac: UO Libraries' Collections Budget Reduction for FY 20"
html:
b'
Hello COE faculty,

I wanted to share with you this memo from Adriene Lim, our Dean of Libraries, regarding a reduction to our library collections budget for Fiscal Year 2020: https://library.uoregon.edu/sites/default/files/node4982/budget_reduction_memo_campus_final_version_april_2019.pdf

One thing I would like to point out is that we will be decreasing streaming video costs by moving to a mediated access model for the streaming video database Kanopy<https://uoregon.kanopy.com/> starting after the end of spring quarter. Our current unlimited access model has proven to be very expensive, so we will be prioritizing licensing films that are being used for teaching and research purposes. This means that starting this summer, you will need to request access to new films that you'd like to use. We have already purchased multi-year licenses for films in the Janus/Criterion collection and several other widely-used titles. All titles currently under license will continue to be available. I should have more information on this to share with you in the future once our Collections Services staff has finalized the procedures for faculty to request films needed for instruction.

Please let me know if you have any questions about this or any of the other steps outlined in the memo. You can also contact Dean Lim or Associate Dean Mark Watson with questions as well.

Best,
Katherine

--
Katherine S. Donaldson
Social Sciences/Education Librarian
University of Oregon Libraries
1299 University of Oregon
Eugene, OR 97403-1299
Phone: 541-346-4132
kdonalds at uoregon.edu<mailto:kdonalds at uoregon.edu>

subject: b'coe-fac: Online access to DSM-5'
html:
b'
?Hello COE faculty,

I wanted to let you know that the UO Libraries now has access to the DSM-5 online. You can access this resource under our Database A-Z list (under "DSM-5 Library Package") or at this link: https://dsm.psychiatryonline.org/doi/book/10.1176/appi.books.9780890425596

I hope this will be a useful resource for any courses you may have where the DSM-5 is required or recommended as a course text/reference.

Katherine

subject: b'coe-fac: Faculty Information for Commencement June 17'
html:
b'
Hello,
I hope everyone is looking forward to Commencement on June 17. Attached are instructions for faculty participation and a map that shows you the line-up area at the lower level of Matt Knight Arena. All you really need to do is show up at the west entrance of Matt Knight Arena by 3:30 pm on Monday, June 17 and our staff will direct you from there.

Below is the list of faculty I who I believe are participating in commencement.  If you aren't on the list and plan on being there, let me know so I can have the correct number of seats reserved.

For those who ordered it, regalia will be delivered to HEDCO 130 sometime next week. I'll let you know when it has arrived so you can come and pick it up.

If you have questions after reading through the attached materials, please let me know.
Thanks,
Lisa

subject: b'coe-fac: SAIL Program Faculty Volunteers Needed'
html:
b'
Hello,
Each year departments and programs across campus participate in a program called the Summer Academic Program to Inspire Learning (SAIL) where students  from local high schools come to spend a week on campus to learn about how to become a college students, including courses on financial aid, scholarship, and general college readiness.  Each participant chooses a major and spends the week learning about it.

The COE participates in this program by having faculty members lead classes for these students.  Each of our undergraduate majors and minors has volunteered to create engaging programming for the students, but there is some time left that we haven't been able to cover yet.

I am hoping to find faculty willing to lead one of two 2-hour blocks of time we have remaining.  These blocks are from 9:30 - 11:30 am  and 1:00 pm - 3:00 pm on Thursday, July 26.  Or someone more adventurous could take all 4 hours!  We'd like programs that can provide programming around the concept of "Being a Change Maker."  For each hour, we ask that there be only 15 minutes of direct instruction at the most, followed by an activity and discussion for the remainder of the time.

I can provide more information to those who are interested or take a look at the SAIL website here:  https://sail.uoregon.edu/

Thanks,
Lisa




Lisa Fortin
Director, Events and Student Recruitment
College of Education
541-346-1607

subject: b'coe-fac: Endowed faculty position selection guidelines'
html:
b'
Dear Faculty,



Thank you for responding to my recent call for feedback on the draft CoE Endowed Faculty Position Selection Guidelines. Of the faculty responding, two had specific suggestions for, a) adding associate deans as nominators for both committee membership and candidates for endowed positions, and b) ensuring that the faculty selection committee is diverse, and that it include faculty at both the associate professor and professor ranks. These additions are reflected in the final document that is being submitted to the Office of the Provost for approval (see two documents attached to this email; one reflecting these changes, and one "clean" version).



Gratefully,



Randy
C Office of the Provost

For scheduling, please contact Maggie Bosworth at  magboz at uoregon.edu<mailto:%20magboz at uoregon.edu> or 541-346-6467.

Designated Reporter: I am required to report any incidents of prohibited discrimination and harassment including sexual violence or sexual harassment that I hear about to the university administration. I will also direct students to resources to help them.
________________________________
[COE logo]

R.W. Kamphaus, Ph.D. | Professor and Dean
randyk at uoregon.edu<mailto:randyk at uoregon.edu> | 541-346-3405
HEDCO 130
1215 University of Oregon | Eugene, OR 97403

subject: b'coe-fac: Kanopy Access Model Changing'
html:
b'
Hello COE faculty,



I am passing on this message from our interim Dean of Libraries (Mark Watson) regarding changes to accessing Kanopy videos. We are moving to a mediated request model for new videos from Kanopy. More details below.



---

The UO Libraries will begin mediating access to new, unlicensed films through the Kanopy Streaming Services<http://researchguides.uoregon.edu/kanopy> starting on July 1, 2019. Kanopy provides a wide range of films for use in teaching and research, and the service has proved to be overwhelmingly popular. As a result, costs for Kanopy have continued to escalate significantly over time and unlimited access is no longer sustainable.



Mediation will help pace spending and result in better stewardship of university funds for new titles. At the same time, the campus community will still be able to access a great deal of unmediated content. All the films with time remaining on their one-year lease as well as the entire Janus/Criterion collection (on a three-year lease) will remain available for unlimited use. As yet to be leased titles will be made available as follows:

*         To UO faculty for use in a course or research

*         To GE's for use in a course

*         To graduate students for research



In order to contain costs, UO staff, emeritus faculty and the general public will not have the ability to request the activation and lease of new titles.


The UO Libraries will strive to make this change in service as efficient as possible. The procedures for requesting access to a title currently unavailable to the UO community are provided in the following LibGuide: http://researchguides.uoregon.edu/c.php?g=942709. Faculty and GEs are encouraged to review the information and submit requests for unleased titles at least one week in advance. Please do not hesitate to contact the UO Libraries, if you have questions or concerns (Dave Fowler, Collection Management Librarian; x6-1839; dcfowler at uoregon.edu<mailto:dcfowler at uoregon.edu>).

--
Katherine S. Donaldson
Social Sciences/Education Librarian
University of Oregon Libraries
1299 University of Oregon
Eugene, OR 97403-1299
Phone: 541-346-4132
kdonalds at uoregon.edu<mailto:kdonalds at uoregon.edu>

-------------- next part --------------
An HTML attachment was scrubbed...
URL: <http://lists-prod.uoregon.edu/pipermail/coe-fac/attachments/20190710/7f529ddf/attachment.html>
'

subject: b'coe-fac: Local Professional Development Opportunity'
html:
b'
Dear Faculty,

Emily Tanner-Smith asked me to bring this event to your attention. It is being offered locally by one of her colleagues and seems to have some timely connections to many of our shared priorities.

"Diversity & Leadership: Building Inclusion in the Workplace," will be held from 2-5pm on September 12th at the Inn at the 5th (more info and registration here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/building-inclusion-in-the-workforce-diversity-leadership-training-tickets-68931942295?aff=ebdssbdestsearch).

Best,
Dianna

---------------
Dianna Carrizales-Engelmann, PhD
Assistant Dean for Administration, College of Education
dcarriza at uoregon.edu<mailto:dcarriza at uoregon.edu> | 541-346-5407
1215 University of Oregon | Eugene, OR 97403-5277

I support all students regardless of immigration status or country of origin. As a Dreamer Ally, I support Dreamer students and promote their sense of belonging and safety as they pursue their higher education goals. For more information and resources please visit our Dreamers<https://www.uoregon.edu/dreamers> page and the Immigration FAQs<https://international.uoregon.edu/immigration_faq> page. I commit to not sharing your status with anyone if you reveal it to me, but also remind you that when interacting with faculty, staff, and offices around campus you are never required to reveal your immigration status.
[uo_logo_green_on_white_2]

"Diversity & Leadership: Building Inclusion in the Workplace," will be held from 2-5pm on September 12th at the Inn at the 5th (more info and registration here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/building-inclusion-in-the-workforce-diversity-leadership-training-tickets-68931942295?aff=ebdssbdestsearch).

Best,
Dianna

subject: b'coe-fac: Hello from the UO Libraries'
html:
b'
Hello COE faculty,

With the beginning of a new academic year, I wanted to remind you of some of the services the UO Libraries and I can offer you, as well as some of the resources we've recently acquired.

Here are a few ways I can help:

  *   Research consultation appointments - schedule a time by using my appointment calendar<http://uoregon.libcal.com/appointment/24599> or send me an email. I will also be trying out offering drop-in research help in the HEDCO Learning Commons on Tuesdays and Thursdays from 1-3 pm this term.
  *   Instruction sessions on research and library resources for your class. Let me know if you'd like me to visit your class. We also have classrooms in Knight Library if you'd like to bring your class here.
  *   Help with getting started with the citation management tools Zotero and Mendeley
  *   Send me your requests for books, DVDs, children's/YA books, etc. that you would like the library to purchase, budget permitting.
  *   I maintain research guides<http://researchguides.uoregon.edu/prf.php?account_id=121286> for some of the programs in the COE. These should automatically appear as a tab on your Canvas course site (that you can toggle on or off as you like).

And here are a few things I wanted to highlight related to some of our newer library resources:

  *   A reminder that we now have electronic access to the DSM-5<http://researchguides.uoregon.edu/DSM-5-Online>
  *   Our trial subscription to Cabells Scholarly Analytics<http://researchguides.uoregon.edu/cabells> (a resource that provides acceptance rates and other metrics for academic journals) will be expiring on Dec. 20, 2019. If you have any feedback about this resource, please share it with me.
  *   Our access model for the streaming video database Kanopy<http://researchguides.uoregon.edu/kanopy/> changed over the summer. Due to rising costs, you will now need to place a request for any films you would like to use for your courses or research. We already have longer-term licenses for all films in the Criterion collection as well as several highly-used titles, but we are happy to activate other films you might need. There are directions on how to place a request here<https://researchguides.uoregon.edu/c.php?g=942709&p=6795405>.

Let me know if you have any questions, suggestions, or other ideas about how the library could support you and your students. I hope you have a good fall term!

Best,
Katherine

--
Katherine S. Donaldson
Social Sciences/Education Librarian
University of Oregon Libraries
1299 University of Oregon
Eugene, OR 97403-1299
Phone: 541-346-4132
kdonalds at uoregon.edu<mailto:kdonalds at uoregon.edu>

-------------- next part --------------
An HTML attachment was scrubbed...
URL: <http://lists-prod.uoregon.edu/pipermail/coe-fac/attachments/20190923/4b301171/attachment.html>
'

subject: b'coe-fac: Policy Review in the COE 2019-2020 -- survey of voting\tfaculty'
html:
b'
Dear Faculty,

Welcome back! In anticipation of a busy school year, I wanted to send this message as soon as possible in the hope that we can make some policy-headway early in the quarter.

We have achieved several significant policy undertakings in the past 4 years. Since 2015, the COE has undertaken the development of 8 CBA-driven policies and we are now in the full implementation of those policies and their related guidelines.  In some cases data have been collected, in some cases change is already visible, and in all cases, lessons have been learned.


As some of you may be aware, according to our COE Internal governance, all 8 of these policies are now technically due or will be due for review in the 2020 calendar year.  According to COE Internal Governance Policy: COE Policies shall be reviewed and voted upon by representative faculty at least every 3 years (lines 601-602). This creates a situation in which multiple faculty committees will be created and convened over the course of the year, likely with some overlap.

While our faculty governance does not address all situations that arise in the college, it does give us a process (i.e., the faculty governance process) with which to approach scenarios like this one.  The survey below proposes 6 possible ways forward to potentially mitigate some of the strain associated with the faculty's full review of 8 policies in a single year https://coedocs.uoregon.edu/display/governance/COE+Policy+Library. The options fall into 3 general categories:
(1) proceed with the full review for all 8 policies,
(2) prioritize a group of policies for review in the short term and planfully develop a sequence for the others, or
(3) change to the internal governance (to either suggest an alternate review period or to develop/vote on an expedited process that can be used with certain policies).


Please let me know by October10th, via the following Qualtrics survey https://oregon.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_e4Xl5H8ya4IGKnr your thoughts about the ideal way to proceed with this work so that we have a streamlined 2019-2020 academic year and are not overly embedded in policy review.


The results of this survey will be consolidated by October 18th so that next steps for COE policy review can proceed in the Fall and Winter quarters.

Best,


Dianna

---------------
Dianna Carrizales-Engelmann, PhD
Assistant Dean for Administration, College of Education
dcarriza at uoregon.edu<mailto:dcarriza at uoregon.edu> | 541-346-5407
1215 University of Oregon | Eugene, OR 97403-5277

I support all students regardless of immigration status or country of origin. As a Dreamer Ally, I support Dreamer students and promote their sense of belonging and safety as they pursue their higher education goals. For more information and resources please visit our Dreamers<https://www.uoregon.edu/dreamers> page and the Immigration FAQs<https://international.uoregon.edu/immigration_faq> page. I commit to not sharing your status with anyone if you reveal it to me, but also remind you that when interacting with faculty, staff, and offices around campus you are never required to reveal your immigration status.
[uo_logo_green_on_white_2]
